loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil, onion, pepper, peanuts, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Darius Magloire

texts.fr: Darius est un homme de 40 ans, père de famille. Il est commerçant et a ouvert une petite alimentation qu'il gère lui même depuis 11 ans. C'est grâce à elle qu'il subvient aux besoins de sa famille. grâce à son accueil chaleureux et ses relations de bon voisinage, il a conquis et fidélisé une clientèle qui s'accroit au fil du temps, et là, il ne parvient plus à la satisfaire totale d'où la nécessité de ce crédit dans son activité en ce moment parce qu'il lui permettra d'augmenter le stock des produits de première nécessité. Ceci augmentera ses ventes et donc sa marge bénéficiaire. Bénéfice qui sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Darius is 40 years old and a father. He is a shopkeeper and has run a small grocery for the past 11 years. 

The grocery allows him to meet the needs of his family. Darius gives a warm welcome and is a good neighbor, which has allowed him to acquire a loyal client base that is growing over time. He can no longer fully meet his clients’ needs, hence the need for a business loan at this time. The loan will allow him to increase the stock of his most important items -  leading to more sales and a higher profit margin.

Part of his income will be reinvested in growing his business, and the rest will allow him to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: Increase the stock of his most important items.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is marriedwith six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rachel is 35 years old and has four children who are in school.

Rachel has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rachel requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Rachel has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Rachel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Hà

texts.en:
Mrs. Hà works in agriculture, farming food. Hà has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Hà is 31 years old and she is married with two children. Hà lives with her two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hà has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a latrine so her family shares the neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to buy stone, cement, sand to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hà hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to buy stone, cement and sand to build a toilet.

loans.name: Lý

texts.en:
Lý works in agriculture, farming food. She has been involved in her business for four years. Lý is 30 years old and she is married with one child. Lý lives with her one dependent in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Lý joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lý has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to buy a water tank and a water filter.

In the future, Lý hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her children to do well in school, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and a water filter.

loans.name: Gretchen

texts.en:
Gretchen is 28 years old with three children, two of whom are in school, Gretchen works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soft drinks, canned goods, chips, eggs, noodles, coffee, etc.

Gretchen has been in this business for three years.

In the future Gretchen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soft drinks, canned goods, chips, eggs, noodles and coffee.

loans.name: Jeneva

texts.en:
Jeneva is from Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She is 37 years old, married and has two school-aged children. Her husband is a tricycle operator. Starting with capitalization of 4,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member in  2012 and has taken out three loans. 

Now, she is applying for 30,000 PHP to restock the inventory of her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities and to buy a second-hand motor unit for passenger transport downtown. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart, and to increase the units of her motorcycle cab operation.

loans.use: to restock her inventory in her sari-sari store (general store) business and to buy a second-hand motor unit.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana works hard to support her family. Rosana is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish for her fish-vending business.

Rosana has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Rosana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish for her fish-vending business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.fr: Joseph est un homme de 45 ans, marié père de 5 enfants dont l'âge varie 8 et 17 ans. Il est commerçant et a ouvert une petite alimentation qu'il gère lui même depuis 13 ans. C'est grâce à elle qu'il subvient aux besoins de sa famille. grâce à son accueil chaleureux et ses relations de bon voisinage, il a conquis et fidélisé une clientèle qui s'accroit au fil du temps, et là, il ne parvient plus à la satisfaire totale d'où la nécessité de ce crédit dans son activité en ce moment parce qu'il lui permettra d'augmenter le stock des produits de première nécessité. Ceci augmentera ses ventes et donc sa marge bénéficiaire. Bénéfice qui sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Joseph is a 45-year-old retailer, married, and the father of five children between the ages of 8 and 17.  He has opened a small grocery store which he has been managing by himself for the past 13 years.  It is thanks to this small shop that he is able to meet the needs of his family.  Thanks to his warm welcome and to the good relationships he entertains with his neighbors, he has also managed to attract an increasingly large group of faithful customers.  However, he can no longer fully meet the demand of such a large group of customers, hence his decision to apply for a loan.   This loan will allow him to increase his stock of staple goods, which will in turn boost his sales and his profit margin.  Joseph will reinvest part of his profits in his business, in order to expand it.  With the rest of the money, he intends to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to increase his stock of staple goods.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 64 years old and lives in Villa Consuelo, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She has a retail business where she generates income and provides for her family's everyday consumption. For almost two years she has been a retailer in her place. She has many avid costumers that regularly buy from her store. 

For their personal purposes, she needs additional capital for her business. She wants to restock her store with basic commodities like rice, noodles and laundry soap. She asks PMPC for financial assistance to help to achieve what she wants. And thus she will generate more income.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like rice, noodles and laundry soap.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.en: Fermin is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in handcrafted jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and natural gemstones. Fermin has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is his story: "When I was a child, I'd rush to my father's workshop after school to practice creating my own designs. Jewelry has been all I ever wanted to do. My designs are inspired by everything I see around me and by our ancestors' jewelry." "Thank you for supporting this microcredit program, for supporting traditional arts, and for believing in us artisans. I plan on using this microcredit to develop new designs and update my collections." Use the link below to view Fermin's silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/5095

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and natural gemstones for his jewelry.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.en:
Leoncio is 63 years old and lives in Aguada, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He has a retail business where he generates income and provides for his family's everyday consumption. 

For almost two years he has been a retailer in his place. He has many avid customers that regular buy from his store. In order to start an additional business venture, he needs finance so as to buy spare parts for his rice mill. He deeply wishes to live a comfortable life in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for a rice mill.

loans.name: Amador

texts.en:
Amador is 53 years old, with five adult children. He lives in Punta Miray, Baliangao, Mismis Occidental. He has been engaged in catering for three years and joined Paglaum in February 2014. He earns a monthly income of PHP 10,000 from his business.  

He applied to Paglaum for a loan worth PHP 50,000 to have additional capital for his eatery. Amador will purchase more kilos of meat and spices for his carenderia. The profit he earns from this business will be used to save for his retirement and for the daily consumption of his family.

loans.use: To purchase more kilos of meat and spices for his carenderia.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 47 years old and lives in Bagumbang, Bonifacio, Mis.Occ. She is widowed with four children. 

Alice has a shop, a sari-sari store (general store). She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan to have additional capital for her sari-sari store. Alice will buy more inventory of soft drinks, rice, canned goods and other sellable items.

Alice has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, Alice hopes to improve her quality of life and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of soft drinks, rice, canned goods and other sellable items.

loans.name: Busarin

texts.en: Busarin is an artisan in Thailand who specializes in handcrafted jewelry. She would like to invest in gemstones and silver components for production, as well as in workers' daily salaries. Busarin has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is her story: "My favorite themes are butterflies, dragonflies and flowers. The idea of making jewelry came not only because I love jewelry, but also because it goes along so well with women. My jewelry is skillfully handmade with delicate patterns. I always pay attention to new or different things that might inspire me." "I can't purchase some materials in the general market, which forces me to contact and buy directly from manufacturers. Unfortunately, they require a high minimum, which is difficult to afford. That's why I thank you for this microcredit. It will let me keep my workshop operating smoothly." Use the link below to view Busarin's handcrafted jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/4398

loans.use: to invest in gemstones and silver components for production, as well as in workers' daily salaries.

loans.name: Sasina

texts.en: Thailand's Sasina specializes in handcrafted jewelry. She would like to cover her team's daily salaries, as well as invest in the purchase of gemstones and other components for production. Sasina has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is her story: "I began by crafting my own jewelry while studying at university. Initially I made what I liked and sold some to friends. There is an important thing I would like to say to my clients worldwide. A part of what I earn with my jewelry will be donated to an orphanage. I would like to participate in giving these children a chance to grow and live, and so will you when you purchase my products. Thank you very much, from the bottom of my heart." "To craft jewelry at a good price I need to buy stones and accessories in bulk. In addition, I need to pay my assistants daily even though I don't have enough orders to give them work at the moment. Thank you very much for your microcredit." Use the link below to view Sasina's handcrafted jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/4686

loans.use: to cover her team's daily salaries, as well as invest in the purchase of gemstones and other components for production.

loans.name: Anusara

texts.en: Anusara is a Thai artisan who combines colorful gemstones in handcrafted jewelry, often with floral designs. She hopes to purchase materials and also be able to pay assistants to help her. Anusara has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is her story: "I love crafting jewelry. I'd like to help conserve the natural world and the original Northern Thai culture that I love. I don't want it to disappear. I feel love and pride for all of my artwork. I'm proud of my designs, proud of creating them, proud to wear them and proud to sell them. In the future, I'd like to have a small shop of my own, in which to sell my jewelry." "To create jewelry at a good price, I need to buy stones and accessories in bulk. In addition, I need to pay my assistants daily, even when I don't have enough orders to give them work at the moment. Thank you for your kind help with this microcredit." Use the link below to view Anusara's handcrafted gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/5045

loans.use: to purchase materials and also be able to pay assistants to help her.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en: Gabriel is a Guatemalan artisan who specializes in handcrafted jewelry. He would like to invest in a purchase of silver and natural jade. Gabriel has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story: "It's been more than 30 years since I got started in handcrafted jewelry. Now is when I most treasure what I enjoy doing, because it has allowed me to bring food to the table and provide my children with an education." "Many thanks for your microcredit - it will let me stock up on raw materials like silver and jade so I can continue crafting more jewelry as well as develop new designs. I'm hoping this will lead to an increase in sales so I may continue providing for my family. Blessings to you!" Use the link below to view Gabriel's handcrafted jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/8680

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and natural jade for his jewelry.

loans.name: Las Gemelas Group

texts.en:
San Juan La Laguna in the department of Solola is a pretty, quiet Mayan town located on the shores of beautiful Lake Atitlan in the highlands of Guatemala. It is a town well known for its traditional natural dye techniques and striking textiles. It is here that the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Gemelas” or “The Twins” was just formed. The eight women in the group are just beginning their first loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. They have a variety of businesses including the sale of clothing and textiles, corn and seafood. One of them owns a Moto taxi called a “tuk tuk” which is a common form of transportation in many towns in Guatemala. The average age of the women is 33 years.

Paulina is a 23-year-old married woman who belongs to “Las Gemelas”. She has twin daughters and it is in their honor that the Trust Bank is called “Las Gemelas”. As her husband fishes every day, Paula sells seafood and is requesting a loan which she will use to expand her business. She plans to buy fishing gear including hooks, nylon fishing line, baskets, and other materials. Paulina tells us that the business is giving the family a pretty good income and also gives her the opportunity to continue with her education. She goes to school at night and is currently in the 9th grade. She is a great example that it is never too late to learn and improve oneself. She gets up early each morning to take care of her husband and their daughters, then goes to the market to sell seafood and then attends school at night.

The ladies of the Trust Bank enjoy getting together at their monthly meetings. During these meetings, a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer provides educational trainings on various subjects. The women are anxious to learn about topics like women’s health and hygiene, identity and leadership, and budgeting and business administration.

These dynamic women want to take the opportunity to express their gratitude to KIVA investors from all parts of the world who believe in them and their goals. The combination of small loans education and educational trainings is a pathway for the women to empower themselves and leave poverty behind. They will face a brighter future and raise their standard of living, benefiting themselves, their families and their community of San Juan La Laguna.

loans.use: To buy fishing gear including hooks, nylon fishing line, baskets.

loans.name: Paraje Tzancoral Group

texts.en:
Santa Lucia La Reforma, Totonicapan, is a town in the western highlands of Guatemala. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Paraje Tzancoral”, is located here and consists of nine women, full of hope for a better and more prosperous future. They have joined the Trust Bank for their own personal development and to improve the lives of their families and community. The women are involved in various commercial ventures including the sale of everyday items including rice, beans, pasta, sugar and tortillas. Some work in animal husbandry and raise chickens, ducks, turkeys and pigs. Their husbands are mostly agricultural field workers who do not make enough to support the families and so the income that the ladies generate is very useful and valuable.

Catarina is a 54-year-old mother of five children. She sells tortillas, an indispensable food in the Guatemalan highlands, that is made from pure corn. Her business is progressing well and she wants to increase it even more. Catarina wants to sell vegetables in the same little storefront where she sells tortillas. She has applied for a loan which she will use to buy larger quantities of corn to produce more tortillas and purchase vegetables as well. Catarina has two employees in order to meet the demands in her customers. She is happy to be able to provide part-time employment so that her employees have an income to support their families.

The nine women of the “Paraje Tzancoral” Trust Bank thank KIVA investors for their generosity and confidence. The additional capital with the small loans combined with the monthly educational trainings on topics like effective business administration and budgeting offered by a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer provides the women with real tools to empower themselves. In this way, the ladies are facing a brighter and more prosperous future. Thank you!

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of corn to produce more tortillas and purchase vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Osmara Carolina

texts.es: Es una mujer amable, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 28 años de edad, casada. Con el propósito de contar con su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 3 años estableció con capital propio una pequeña pulpería, en la cual inicio ofertando granos básicos y chiverías. Gracias a los ingresos percibidos y al primer financiamiento otorgado por PANA PANA hace 1 año, le han permitido crecer en su negocio, comprar una mantenedora y construir un anexo de concreto en su vivienda, expandiendo su negocio de pulpería. Solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar inventario para su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos: 12 bolsones de chivería, un bolsón de papel higiénico, toallas sanitarias, sopas instantáneas, granos básicos, café instantáneo, jabones de baño y de lavar ropa, embutidos, pollo, carne molida, gaseosas, jugos y agua purificada. Su sueño es ir creciendo y en futuro establecer una abarrotería.
texts.en:
Osmara is a friendly woman and originally from Puerto Cabezas. She is 28 years old and married. In order to have her own source of income, three years ago Osmara started her own little grocery store with her own capital. In the beginning, Osmara sold just basic grains and dairy products. Thanks to her income and her first loan from "Pana Pana" a year ago, however, her business has grown and Osmara has bought a fridge and built an extension on her house, thus expanding the grocery store.

Osmara is applying for her second loan in order to buy stock for her business and improve her income; Osmara will buy:twelve bags of dairy products, toilet rolls, sanitary towels, soap, basic grains, instant coffee, bath soaps and soaps for washing clothes, cold meats, chicken, ground meat, fizzy drinks and water.

loans.use: to buy stock for her business and improve her income; Osmara will buy:twelve bags of dairy products, toilet rolls, sanitary towels, soap, basic grains, instant coffee, bath soaps and soaps for washing clothes, cold meats, chicken, ground meat, fizzy drinks and water.

loans.name: Bárbara

texts.es:
Bárbara tiene 23 años de edad, vive en la casa de su abuela con su pareja, está cursando el último año de la Carrera de Derecho, trabaja en la Fiscalía desde hace varios años, le gusta lo que hace pero quiere seguir creciendo por ello desea graduarse como profesional.
Paga sus estudios con mucho sacrificio y además ayuda a su abuela con quien vive. Solicita el préstamo para pagar las cuotas en la culminación de sus estudios ya que últimamente ha tenido muchos gastos con una pequeña enfermedad que aquejó a su abuela.
texts.en:
Bárbara is 23 years old and lives with her partner at her grandmother's house. Bárbara is studying her final year of law and has been working in the public prosecutor's office for a number of years. Bárbara likes what she does but she wants to continue growing and so wants to graduate with a profession.

Bárbara pays for her studies with a lot of sacrifice. She also helps her grandmother. Bárbara is applying for this loan in order to pay university fees for the end of her studies. Lately Bárbara has had a lot of expenses as her grandmother was ill.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Cintia

texts.es:
La Cintia tiene 27 años y está casada, tiene 2 hijos, quienes son su motivo de lucha, ya que quiere poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Una de sus aspiraciones es ejercer su profesión en una empresa grande y más adelante tener su propia oficina. Ella está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, donde pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder cumplir su meta.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas y así seguir para cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Cintia is 27 years old, married and has two children. Her children are her motivation for fighting in life as she wants to give them everything that she could not have.

One of Cintia's aspirations is to practice her profession in a large business and, in the future, to have her own office. Cintia is studying accounting and puts in her best effort in order to achieve this goal.

Cintia is applying for this loan in order to pay university fees and to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Pablina

texts.es:
Pablina es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, ella cuenta que trabajó desde los 13 años para poder estudiar, sus padres son separados y no pueden con los gastos de ella.
Su meta es poder ser una profesional que pueda ayudar a las demás personas, es por eso que está estudiando la carrera de psicología. Su aspiración es poder ayudar a su familia, ya que ellos son su razón de ser.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Pablina is from the city of Coronel Oviedo and, in order to go to school, has been working since she was 13 years old. Her parents are separated and cannot support Pablina's expenses.

Pablina's goal is to become a professional who can help other people and so she is studying psychology. She aspires to help her family, as they are the reason that she is alive.

Pablina is applying for this loan in order to invest it in paying her university fees so that she can continue studying.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Asep

texts.en:
Asep runs a small stall where he sells mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. He lives in Lebak, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. Asep  is single and lives with five persons in the family home.

Asep began working with Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. For the last month, he has had around $45 – $46 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on the weekends.

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en:
Odgerel, 33 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

She has been working as a driver for the state for five months. Before this she used to sell casual clothes by renting a stall at the trade center. Her husband has a position of bookkeeper at a private firm. Their son goes to a school specialized in athletics. 

Recently she began building a barn next to her house in order to prevent heat loss and reduce coal use. She is requesting a loan of 1,150 USD to buy cement and bricks for completing the barn. By doing so, her family will live in a warm house where less coal is burned and then less pollutants will be released into the air. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks for completing the barn.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad works hard to support her family. Trinidad is married and has a vegetable- vending business in the Philippines. Trinidad has been in this business for one year now.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of vegetables to sell.

In the future, Trinidad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: 13.03.05 - Quảng Thành Group

texts.en:
Hương is 58 years old, married, and has four children. Hương lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She is the group leader of the 13.03.05 - Quảng Thành solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

Hương works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Hương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

This is Hương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Hương hopes to travel for vacation within the country, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Nhã

texts.en:
Nhã is 45 years old and she is married and has three children. Nhã lives with three dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. Nhã has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

In 2010, Nhã joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nhã has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygenic latrine.She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

Nhã hopes to make enough money to provide for her children and for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Jinilyn

texts.en:
Jinilyn works hard to support her family. Jinilyn is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

In the future, Jinilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: 13.03.07 - Quảng Thành Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hà works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Hà is 32 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 13.03.07 - Quảng Thành solidarity group, which consists of four members. Hà lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hà's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hà has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Hà hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 13.03.10 - Quảng Thành Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Trang works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Trang is 42 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 13.03.10 - Quảng Thành solidarity group, which consists of four members. Trang lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Trang's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Trang has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Trang faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Trang hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 07.01.24 Phú Sơn 1 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thủy has a retail business selling dry food and general things. She is requesting a loan to purchase dry food and general things to resell.

Thủy is 36 years old and she is married with 2 children.  Thủy is the group leader of the 07.01.24 Phú Sơn 1 solidarity group, which consists of 4 members.   She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.   Thủy has been involved in this business for 5 years.  The main hardship that Thủy faces in her business is the lack of capital.  With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

In 2012, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thủy has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

loans.use: to purchase dry food and general things to resell.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 50 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school.  Jovita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell .

Jovita has been in this business for 25 years. 

In the future, Jovita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Romina

texts.es:
Romina es de la ciudad de Villarrica, es estudiante de la carrera de enfermería. Comenta que estudia esta carrera ya que siempre quiso ayudar a los demás, y por medio de esto podrá hacerlo.
Sus metas son poder tener su título y trabajar en su ciudad, ser independiente y poder salir adelante por sus propios medios. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas y también para poder cubrir sus gastos de transporte, con lo que podrá seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Romina is from the city of Villarrica.  She is a nursing student.  She says she is studying nursing since she has always wanted to help other people and this allows her to do so.  

Her goals are to obtain her degree and work in her city, become independent, and be able to succeed in her own way.  She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving and it will be a lot of help.

She is requesting this loan to pay for her fees and cover her transportation costs, so that she can continue studying like she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay school fees and transportation costs.

loans.name: 13.03.06 - Quảng Thành Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thảnh works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Thảnh is 35 years old and she is married with one child. Thảnh is the group leader of the 13.03.06 - Quảng Thành solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives with one dependent in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thảnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thảnh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Thảnh hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 07.01.25 Phú Sơn 1 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyệt works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry and cattle to raise and resell.

Nguyệt is 55 years old, and she is married with 2 children.  Nguyệt is the group leader of the 07.01.25 Phú Sơn 1 solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. She lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.  Nguyệt has been involved in this business for 6 years.
The main hardship that Nguyệt faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nguyệt hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

In 2012, Nguyệt joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nguyệt has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry and cattle to raise and resell.

loans.name: 05.01.60 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phương has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothes for resale.

Phương is 49 years old, and she is married with 2 children. Phương is the group leader of the 05.01.60 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of 7 members.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents. Phương has been involved in this business for 7 years.  The main hardship that Phương faces in her business is the lack of capital.  With her business profit, Phương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

In 2010, Phương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Phương has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming supplies to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: 13.03.09 - Quảng Thành Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lý works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Lý is 42 years old, and she is married with 2 children.  Lý is the group leader of the 13.03.09 - Quảng Thành solidarity group, which consists of 4 members.  Lý lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.  This is Lý first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Lý has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Lý faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lý hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lorna has been in this business for 10 years now.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net to sell.

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net to sell

loans.name: Venera

texts.ru: Венере 31 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Венеры - средне-специальное образование, в данный момент работает медсестрой в местной больнице. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Венера вместе с мужем занимается животноводством, стартовав 8 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Венеры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Венера обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Венера планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Venera is 31 years old, married and together with her husband, is raising four children.  Venera has been educated in nursing and is currently working at the local hospital.  The main source of income for Venera's family is cattle raising.  Venera and her husband started this business 8 years ago by purchasing cattle for 10,000 som.  Thanks to Venera's hard work, she now has 3 cows and a horse.  The monthly income from this business is 15,000 som.  

In order to expand her business further, Venera turned to the bank of Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan to purchase cows.  A part of her profits from the enterprise Venera is planning to reinvest into further expanding her herd, and she is planning to save the rest for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Flora Del Carmen

texts.es: Flora del Carmen, mayor de edad madre soltera de tres hijos los cuales todos son independientes, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del pais, donde predomina el comercio, y existe uno de los ingenios mas grande del pais, Flora se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, y con muchos deseos de superacion personal, inicia su negocio desde hace varios años como un medio de subsistir y apoyar en los gastos del hogar, Flora es una microempresaria y administradora de su propio negocio que consiste en la elaboracion de pastes artesanales en su casa de habitacion, ella realiza sus compras de materia prima a productores de otro municipio,y los otros complementos en otro departamento, sus ventas son  al contado a comerciantes de mercados de otra localidad, el objetivo de este credito es para comprar materia prima como: retazos de telas, hilos, agujas, mecates entre otros y aprovechar este tiempo ya que en invierno se escasea el paste  y los productores lo dan más caro y de esa manera cubrir varios pedidos que tiene de sus clientes, logrando incrementar mas sus ingresos.-
texts.en:
Flora del Carmen is a single mother of three children who are all independent.  She is originally from one of the towns in Chinandega, located in the western part of the country, where there is a lot of commerce, including one of the largest sugar factories in the country.  

Flora is known for being a hardworking and responsible woman with a desire to improve herself.  She started her business many years ago as a way to support herself and pay her household expenses.  Flora owns her own business where she makes traditional fabric art in her home.  She purchases her materials from producers in another town and the other supplies in another department.  She makes her sales in cash to merchants at markets in another town.

She is requesting this loan to purchase materials such as fabric pieces, thread, needles, ropes, and other items.  She wants to take advantage of this time, since her materials become scarce in the winter and producers sell it for more.  This will allow her to fulfill several orders that her customers have made and increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as fabric pieces, ropes, thread, and needles.

loans.name: 08-01-14-Phú Sơn 2 Group

texts.en:
Bào is 52 years old, married, and has three children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

Bào operates a food stall/restaurant selling tofu. Bào has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Bào faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Bào is the group leader of the 08-01-14-Phú Sơn2 solidarity group, which consists of five members. This is Bào's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase beans to make tofu to sell.

With her business profit, Bào hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase beans to make tofu for sale.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 52 years old, married, and has six children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Lilia has been raising livestock for 25 years now, and she has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Lilia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional cow to raise.

In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow to raise.

loans.name: Anipakhon

texts.ru: Анипохон 60 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Анипохон - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Анипохон занимается животноводством, стартовав 24 года назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Анипохон, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 дойных коров, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анипохон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Анипохон планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Anipakhon is 60 years old and together with her husband is raising three children.  Anipakhon has a high school education.  The main source of income for her family is cattle raising.  She started this business 24 years ago by purchasing cattle for 5,000 som.  Thanks to Anipakhon's hard work she now has 6 cows and 20 sheep.  Her monthly income is 10,000 som.  In order to expand her business Anipakhon turned to the bank of Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan to purchase cows.  Some profits from her business Anipakhon plans to reinvest into expanding her herd and save the rest to be used for the repairs of her home.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 63 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. Vilma has been in this business for 30 years.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sugar, coffee, shampoo, soap, etc. to sell.

In the future Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sugar, coffee, shampoo, soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina is 35 years old and married with five children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

For 16 years, Ma. Cristina has run a retail business, selling nipa roofing material. She has requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

In the future, Ma. Cristina would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of roofing material to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Maria has been in this business for 32 years now.

Maria has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta is married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marta is 46 years old and has one child who is still in school.

For 24 years, Marta has had a retail business, selling vegetables and fruits in the Philippines. Marta has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

In the future, Marta would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire a liquefied petroleum gas stove system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To obtain a quick cooking solution through a liquefied petroleum gas package.

loans.name: Sari Pertami Group

texts.en:
The Sari Pertami group from Melaya, western Bali, would like to thank lenders for their support.  

Ni Ketut, the group head, purchased a sow with her loan. The sow has already given birth to 8 piglets, and they became fat and healthy. At the end of the loan period, Ni Ketut sold her piglets for 500,000 IDR each, yielding a respectable profit.  With her profits, and with the help of a new loan from MUK, she plans to purchase an additional sow.  With the overall increase in household income, she has supported the daily needs of her family and repaired her house.

Because most of the group members already have sows, they also want to purchase superior-quality piglets and feed and to repair cages. The pig-raising business has proven to supplement their family incomes.

Ni Ketut will use her portion of the loan to buy another sow and super-quality feed so that her pigs can grow quickly. She plans to save money to develop her business. The pig business helps her to meet the family's needs and supplement her savings.

loans.use: To purchase a sow and super-quality feed

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 38 years old and married with three children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

For the past year, Merlita has run a direct-selling business, selling Avon products in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of Avon products to sell.

In the future, Merlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of Avon products to sell

loans.name: Onana

texts.fr: Onana est une femme de 39 ans, mariée mère de 5 enfants, elle a aussi 3 autres personnes à sa charge. Elle est commerçante et a ouvert une petite alimentation qu'elle gère lui même depuis 04 an dans la quartier de la place. C'est grâce à elle qu'elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille. grâce à son accueil chaleureux et ses relations de bon voisinage, elle a conquise et fidélisée une clientèle qui s'accroit au fil du temps, et là, elle ne parvient plus à la satisfaire totale d'où la nécessité de ce crédit dans son activité en ce moment parce qu'elle lui permettra d'augmenter le stock des produits de première nécessité. Ceci augmentera ses ventes et donc sa marge bénéficiaire. Bénéfice qui sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Onana is a 39-year-old woman, married, and a mother of five children. She also takes care of three other people. She is a merchant and opened a small food store in the area, which she has now been running for four years. Thanks to this business she is able to support her family's needs.

Her welcoming nature and good neighborhood relations has helped her attract a loyal group of customers, who keep growing over time. However, she is no longer able to serve them completely, and thus needs a loan in order to increase her stock of basic goods.

This will then increase her sales and also her profit margin.

Earnings will be partly reinvested in her business in order to expand and the rest will be used to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock of basic goods

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Priscila is 49 years old and married with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

For the past 5 years, Priscila has run a retail nipa roofing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of nipa to sell.

Priscila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of nipa to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana works hard to support her family. Susana is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Susana has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Susana would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Chrisma

texts.en:
Chrisma is a 49 year old woman and is married to Agustinus, a 64 year old man. They have three children:  Clinton, 21, who is in college; Naldo, 16, who is in the second year of Senior High School; and Nana, 14, who is in her sixth grade of Elementary School. 

Chrisma has a boarding house business and has operated this for three years since her husband retired as a civil servant. Chrisma has 15 rented rooms filled by students from different places. 

Chrisma plans to open a simple kiosk business to facilitate her boarders in meeting their daily needs. Therefore, Chrisma requested a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM to initiate a kiosk business. The loan will be spent on the kiosk stock such as coffee, sugar, tea, soap, and snacks etc.

loans.use: to purchase kiosk stock such as coffee, sugar, tea, soap and snacks, etc

loans.name: Vivien

texts.en:
Vivien is 39 years old and married with five children.  With three children in school, Vivien works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, sugar, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Vivien has been in this business for seven years.

In the future Vivien would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, sugar, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ligia Del Socorro

texts.es: Ligia, con 47 años de edad, trabaja en el gremio de las confecciones desde hace 23 años. En la actualidad presta el servicio de confección a terceros, pero el inconveniente con ellos es que le pagan mes vencido y esto afecta la economía familiar, por lo tanto Ligia sueña con mejorar su negocio y tener su propia línea de prendas para ofrecerlas en el almacén que anhela abrir en un futuro. Esto la impulsa a solicitar el crédito ya que necesita adquirir insumos como hilos, telas y botones para poder cumplir con los compromisos a terceros y no perder su fidelidad ante el gremio.  Todo esto en conjunto le traerá mayores beneficios económicos y el bienestar familiar que requiere para ser feliz en compañía de los que ama.
texts.en:
Ligia, age 47, has been working in the sewing profession for 23 years.  She currently makes clothes for third parties.  The difficulty with this is they pay her monthly in arrears, and this affects the family finances.  Therefore, Ligia dreams of improving her business and having her own line of clothes.  She will sell them in the store that she yearns to open in the future.

This drives her to request a loan because she needs to get supplies like thread, fabric, and buttons.  She needs these to be able to complete her commitments to third parties and to not lose their loyalty in the field.  All of this will bring her greater financial profits and her family’s well-being.  She needs this in order to be happy in the company of her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy supplies like thread, fabric, and buttons.

loans.name: Nieve

texts.es:
Nieve es madre de una pequeña niña, vive con su madre. Ella comenta que ya ha terminado la carrera de psicología y actualmente está siguiendo la carrera de habilitación pedagógica para de esta forma también tener la posibilidad de enseñar. Cree que el estudio es lo único que puede sacarnos de la pobreza, es por eso que ella sigue luchando para poder demostrarlo con el ejemplo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Nieve has a little girl, and she lives with her mother.  She says that she has finished her degree in psychology.  She is currently continuing with studies for her pedagogical certification.  This way she will also have the possibility of teaching.  She believes that education is the only thing that can get us out of poverty.  That is why she continues struggling in order to be able to show this by example.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay for her tuition expenses.  This way she will be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay tuition expenses.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 35 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, etc.

Michelle has borrowed and repaid twelve loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Michelle aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open her own bar

loans.name: Marie Therese

texts.fr: Marie Thérèse est une dame âgée de 35 ans célibataire, mère d'un enfant de .Elle dispose d'une vente à emporter dans un quartier de la capitale quelle elle même depuis  02 ans environ. Son activité fonctionne bien grâce à son savoir faire, son accueil chaleureux et ses bonnes relations avec  le voisinage. Elle voudrait avec ce crédit pour augmenter les casiers de boissons parce qu'elle est souvent confrontée à des ruptures permanentes de stocks à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l(oblige à faire écouler une bonne partie de son stock avant de se réapprovisionner. Ceci augmentera non seulement son chiffre d'affaires mais aussi son bénéfice. Bénéfice qui lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie Thérèse is a 35-year-old single woman and a mother of one child. She owns a take-away stand in an area of the capital, which she has been running for about two years. This business works well thanks to her know-how, her welcoming demeanor, and her good neighborhood relations.

Marie Thérèse would like this loan to increase her stock of beverages, because she is often faced with gaps in her stock due to her lack of capital (she must first sell a large portion of her stock before she can procure new products).

By increasing her stock, she will also not only increase turnover but also her profits.

Earnings will allow her to better support her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock of beverages

loans.name: Tunas Mekar Asih Group

texts.en:
This is the ninth loan for the Tunas Mekar Asih group and Ni Ketut joined the group during the period. The Tunas Mekar Asih group made the payment of 16,500,000 IDR to MUK on time. They tell us that there’s an increasing profit that they earned during the loan period of eight months. The pigs can grow fat and healthy. They can sell the pigs at a high price because there is lots of demand from the market. The situations stimulate their spirit to run the business. 

In this ninth loan, Ni Ketut sold six of her fattened pigs and earned a satisfactory profit. One member feels the benefit of the pig business. Now she has enough profit to run the business with her own capital and stop borrowing. She said she is grateful to lenders, Kiva and MUK. She becomes an example to other friends in her group.

The Tunas Mekar Asih group is receiving a new loan of 15,000,000 IDR. The loan will be used for increasing the number of piglets, renovating the barns and purchasing superior feed. The group still needs a loan until they have enough capital to run the business by themselves. Now they already have savings and will use it for capital.

Ni Ketut and the members feel happy receiving the support all this time from lenders, Kiva and MUK. She uses the loan to purchase superior piglets for fattening pigs. She hopes she can save enough soon to continue the business by herself.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets

loans.name: Nelci

texts.en:
Nelci is a 52-year-old woman who is married to Timotius, 51, an entrepreneur. From their marriage, they are blessed with 3 children: Melati, 19, who is in college; Putra, 16, who attends marine-merchant school; and Indra, 10, an elementary-school student. 

Nelci has a home business producing crispy cassava chips. After producing the chips, she delivers them to kiosks and food stalls near her house. She has been in this business for more than 10 years. She initiated the business using her own capital, an investment of IDR 50,000. The income generated from her business is approximately IDR 400,000 to IDR 500,000 every month.

Due to demand from her customers, she needs to buy 50 kilograms of cassava to produce the chips and as well as ingredients such as cooking oil and sugar. At the moment, she also needs money for her son's education fees. Therefore, she has requested an individual loan of IDR 3,000,000, to be spent on her son's education fees and to buy more cassava.

loans.use: to pay for her child's education fees and to buy more cassava

loans.name: Sokha Group

texts.en: Sokha is 28 years old. He is a married man with one child, and he lives in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. To earn a living, he works as a foreman laying underground TV cables, and his wife is a garment factory laborer. Sokha is a leader of this borrower group. He will use his portion of the group's loan to buy the ground parts for a latrine. This loan will help him to live in good conditions. In the future, Sokha hopes that he can expand his business and earn more income and that his child can get a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: To buy materials for a latrine

loans.name: Hasel

texts.en: Hasel, a mother of two, lives with her family. She works in a private company while her husband does business at home. Her husband is responsible for  retailing grocery goods in their village. The couple earns a good income from these activities. Hasel wants to improve their living situation and recently borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to finance house renovation. In the future, she wants to provide her family a better living and better education for her children.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Ana Del Socorro

texts.es: Ana, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la ganadería. Desde muy joven trabaja en la cría de cerdos y tiene experiencia con productos agrícolas,  actualmente trabaja sola y su anhelo principal es incrementar la venta de cerdos, por lo que solicitó el crédito a la Corporación y con este comprará más cerdos, gallinaza y los insumos necesarios para la cría de los mismos como vacunas, cuidos y vitaminas; de esta forma Ana podrá continuar ofreciendo animales de muy buena calidad y sus ventas incrementarán sus ganancias mejorando su nivel y calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana is married and her husband works in animal husbandry. From a very young age, she worked in pig raising and has experience with agricultural products. Currently, she works alone and her main desire is to increase the sale of the pigs. For this, she applied for the loan from the Corporation. With this, she will buy more pigs, manure, and the supplies necessary for raising them like vaccines, feed and vitamins. In this manner, Ana will be able to continue offering good quality animals and her sales will increase her income, improving her level and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more pigs, manure, and the supplies necessary for raising them like vaccines, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Ovidio

texts.es: Ovidio, con 39 años de edad, es casado y padre de 2 hijos. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, un visionario y buen negociante. Siempre ha trabajado como comerciante, vendiendo artesanías y, desde hace 13 años tiene su propio negocio.  Ha sabido superar tiempos difíciles en el comercio y sueña con comprarse su casa propia y tener un negocio que perdure en el tiempo; es por ello que Ovidio acudió a solicitar un préstamo, el cual utilizará para comprar más mercancía (artesanías en madera, cuero, pinturas, bronce) y también una vitrina para exhibir los productos. Ovidio es un hombre muy organizado y le gusta ofrecer a sus clientes una gran variedad de productos de diversos lugares del país, y se siente a gusto cuando visitan su almacén que tiene un ambiente bello y muy agradable.  La suma de todo estos esfuerzos le brindan a toda su familia una calidad de vida excelente y sin mayores inconvenientes.
texts.en:
Ovidio, 39, is married and the father of two children. He is known for being a very responsible and hardworking man, a visionary and a good negotiator. He has always worked as a salesperson, selling crafts. For the last 13 years, he has had his own business. He has known how to overcome difficult times in the business and dreams of buying his own house and having a business that endures time. For this reason, Ovidio came forth to apply for a loan, which he will use to buy more merchandise (wooden crafts, leather, paintings, bronze) and also a display case to show the products.

Ovidio is a very organized man and he likes to offer his clients a great variety of products from different places in the country. He feels comfortable when they visit his shop, which has a pretty and very agreeable ambience. The sum of all of these efforts is that he provides an excellent quality of life to all of his family and without large inconveniences.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise (wooden crafts, leather, paintings, bronze) and also a display case to show the products.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. For more than four years running this business, she has earned a better income, aside from farming. With her generated revenue, her previous loan that was used for purchasing spare parts and accessories was successfully repaid. Edna also used a portion of her profit to improve their own farm, their main source of income. 

To buy new tires, Edna took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit. 

In the future, Edna wants to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Eunice De Las Misericordias

texts.es: Eunice es casada tiene un hijo menor de edad. Toda su vida ha trabajado en confecciones y desde el año 2007 tiene su propio taller donde trabaja por temporadas a terceros y también confecciona su línea propia. Es una persona que da oportunidad de empleo a mujeres cabeza de familia. Eunice sueña con tener un taller en excelentes condiciones y requiere el crédito para hacerle mejoras al taller (resanar, pintar, cambiar las luces, etc) y adquirir insumos (hilos, agujas, telas, resortes, botones) al por mayor ya que en temporadas altas se aumentan los costos y también escasean. Estas mejoras tendrán como resultado poder aumentar la producción y las ventas lo que significa un incremento en los ingresos y mejoramiento general tanto en el bienestar de su familia y en el de las empleadas que le colaboran como empleadas directas.
texts.en:
Eunice is married, she has a young son. All of her life, she has worked as a seamstress. Since 2007, she's had her own workshop where she works seasonally and for third parties. She also sews her own line. She is a person who gives work opportunities to women head-of-households. Eunice dreams of having a workshop in excellent condition and requires the loan to renovate the workshop: (resurface, paint, change the lights, etc) and acquire supplies (thread, needles, cloth, elastic, buttons) in bulk. In high season, the costs go up and there are also scarcities. 

These improvements will, as a result, be able to increase production and sales. This means an increase in income and general improvement in the wellbeing of her family and in those of the employees, who collaborate as direct employees.

loans.use: to renovate her workshop (resurface, paint, change the lights, etc) and acquire supplies (thread, needles, cloth, elastic, buttons) in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Linnah

texts.en: Linnah is a 43 year old married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be determined and straight forward. She operates a M-pesa business where she offers mobile phone based money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are small scale customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be that she operates the business in a  rented business premise. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to add M-pesa float ( money for customers to withdraw). Her business goal is to excel within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan of kes 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: add M-pesa float ( money for customers to withdraw)

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
Bernadita is 58 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc..

Bernadita has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Bernadita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 31 years old, married and has one child.

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Evelyn has been in her business for four years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa works hard to support her family. Elsa is married and has a fishing business in The Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing nets and gasoline for her business.

Elsa has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Elsa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and gasoline for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 40 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of nipa to sell.

Ma. Fe has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running buy and sell nipa roofing for 8 years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of nipa to sell

loans.name: Kap's Group

texts.en:
Aged 50 and a resident from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Kap is a married mother blessed with three kids. She earns a living via rice farming and sesame planting, with which she has been occupied for 30 years, earning 30,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

This is the sixth loan cycle for Kap, with successful repayment of her past five loans that have supported her business and improved her living conditions at a gradual pace. 

This loan cycle, she is the leader of her group consisting of five female borrowers with the total loan amount of 5,800,000 KHR, of which 1,400,000 KHR is her loan portion. As a group representative, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, seed and pesticide for her rice farmland. She hopes to gain a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed and pesticide for her rice farmland

loans.name: Alberto De Jesús

texts.es: Alberto, a sus 55 años de edad, es casado y vive en un municipio del oriente antioqueño. Desde hace 4 años tiene una chaza en el parque principal del pueblo y cerca de un colegio, ha tenido situaciones económicas difíciles, pero con empeño y dedicación ha logrado sobrepasar todos los obstáculos. Alberto sueña con tener un negocio más grande y consolidado, con el préstamo que solicita comprará surtido al por mayor (galletería, dulces, refrescos, cigarrillos) para ofrecerle a sus clientes más variedad de productos y de esta forma las ventas aumentarán considerablemente, esto le dará a él una mayor estabilidad económica y podrá suplir todas las necesidades básicas de su familia y mejorar el nivel de vida.
texts.en: Alberto is 55 years old. He is married and lives in a town in Eastern Antioquia. For four years, he has had a convenience store in the main park of the town and close to a high school. He has had difficult financial situations, but with hard work and dedication, he has been able to overcome the obstacles. Alberto dreams of having a bigger and more consolidated business. With the loan he has asked for, he will buy merchandise wholesale (cookies, candies, beverages, cigarettes) to offer his customers a wider variety of products. In this way, he will have more financial stability and be able to meet his family's basic needs and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale (cookies, candies, beverages, cigarettes).

loans.name: Koeurn's Group

texts.en: Koeurn is 45 years old, and she is a local villager of the Battambang province. She is a widowed mother of three kids. Rice farming has been the main source of her income for 20 years. This business has earned her 30,000 KHR per day. She has been with Vision Fund(Kiva’s partner) for two loan cycles. Now, she is applying for a new loan, and she leads the group consisting of two. She is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 KHR and her co-borrower is requesting 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for pesticide and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes her business will improve more than before.

loans.use: to pay for pesticide and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Joselina

texts.en: Joselina , a mother of four, manages their own banana farm to make a living. For many years in this business, she earns to provide for the family and support her children's education. With her generated income, her previous loan that was used for farming was successfully repaid. To improve the farm, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer and cover weeding maintenance costs.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cover weeding maintenance costs.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Rosita has been in this business for 3 years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 67 years old and married. She has four children.  

Estrella is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Estrella requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Estrella has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Estrella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jose Marvin

texts.es:
José, desde su niñez aprendió lo relacionado con la agricultura y la ganadería, con estos conocimientos es que hoy en día ha podido tener los recursos económicos con los que sale adelante, es casado, junto a su esposa han procreado cuatro hijos, los cuales dependen totalmente de él.
José solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de dos cerdos de engorde y alimento para los mismos, los cuidara y luego venderá a un mejor precio, de esta manera agregara otra actividad económica que le genere ingresos extras para cancelar la deuda y mejorar el estilo de vida que ofrece a su familia.
Su aspiración es aumentar el ganado y mantenerse comercializando cerdos, para que su negocio tenga una mejor rentabilidad.
texts.en:
Since he was a child, José has learned everything related to farming and livestock. With this knowledge, he has now been able to have the financial resources to get ahead. He is married and he and his wife have four children who depend totally on him. 

José is asking for a loan to invest in buying two pigs to fatten up and feed for them. He will care for them and sell them at a better price In this way, he will add another economic activity that will generate extra income to pay off the debt and improve the lifestyle he offers his family. 

He aspires to increase his number of livestock and keep selling pigs so that his business will have more profitability.

loans.use: to buy two pigs to fatten up and feed for them.

loans.name: José Samuel

texts.es: José con 65 años de edad, es una persona que no encuentra fácilmente un empleo y, en vista de las necesidades económicas, inició con una chaza la cual tuvo muy buena acogida y debido a la gran demanda de productos, optó por montar una tienda de abarrotes, donde vende dulces, productos de panadería, refrescos, lácteos.  José sueña con ampliar su negocio y hacerle adecuaciones, es por esto que solicitó el préstamo para adquirir surtido al por mayor (lácteos, galletería, mecatos, dulcería) y también materiales para hacerle mejoras a su tienda (resanar y pintar las paredes), lo cual le permitirá ofrecer a su clientela un lugar ameno y muy agradable donde pueda encontrar productos variados y económicos. José tiene la ventaja de ser reconocido en el sector por ser una persona muy amable y luchador, y gracias a ello tendrá la capacidad para  multiplicar sus ingresos y su nivel de vida irá mejorando poco a poco para disfrutar una vejez tranquila.
texts.en: José 65 years old. He is a person who can't find a job easily, and because of his financial needs, he started with a small sales stall. It was very well received and due to the great product demand, he decided to open a convenience store where he sells candies, baked goods, beverages, and dairy products. José dreams of expanding his business and making improvements. That is why he has asked for the loan to acquire merchandise (dairy products, cookies, snacks, candies), as well as materials to make improvements on his store (repairing and painting the walls). This will allow him to offer his customers a nice, pleasant place where they can find a variety of economic products. José has the advantage of being well known in the area as a friendly man who is a fighter. Thanks to that, he will have the ability to multiply his income and his quality of life will improve little by little to enjoy a peaceful old age.

loans.use: to acquire merchandise wholesale (dairy products, cookies, snacks, candies) as well as materials to do some improvements on his store (repairing and painting the walls).

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 38 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Emma is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds for her pigs.

Emma has been in the pig fattening business for 15 years and also earns additional income from a restaurant.

Emma is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Mechelyn

texts.en:
Mechelyn works hard to support her family. Mechelyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to buy fsihing materials for her business.

Mechelyn has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future Mechelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fsihing materials for her business

loans.name: Vy's Group

texts.en:
Vy is 50 years old and a local villager from Battambang province. She is a mother of six children, three of whom are in school. She earns income to support her family via rice farming and fish catching, with which she has been involved for 12 years. Including this loan, she is in her sixth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) with a successful repayment of her past loans, which have enabled her to improve her lifestyle at a good pace.
