Now, she leads the group of two, and she is requesting a loan in total amount of 2,400,000 KHR (Cambodian riels), of which 1,000,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for reaping and plowing fees. She hopes that she can gain a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for reaping and plowing fees

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch, a mother of seven children, is 41 years old and a resident from Moung Russey district of the Battambang province. Nowadays, only three children still count on her, two school children and one child too young for schooling. To feed her family, rice farming and her paid-working job are the only sources of income. She has done this for 12 years and it returns to her about 26,600 KHR per day.

Touch has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past six cycles and has successfully repaid her loans. Now, her living condition is getting better than before. As the leader of the group, Touch will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing and reaping fees. She strongly hopes that she can keep improving her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing and reaping fees.

loans.name: Chhea's Group

texts.en:
Chhea, 48, is a citizen of the Battambang province. He is married and blessed with six children, three of whom are in school. The main source of his income is from his pig-raising business. This business, which he has been involved in for three years, earns him 16,600 KHR per day. 

This is the second cycle loan for Chhea with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and he is the group leader. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 KHR and his joint-borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, he will use his entire loan portion to buy feed for his pigs. He hopes that this business will generate him a good income so he can better his lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en:
Vanny is a married mother of six children, two of whom are studying at a local university. She is in her late 50s. She is a resident from the Battambang province where her crop is grown and her honey-selling business is run.

Now, she is the leader of the microloan group consisting of two in a third cycle loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is applying for a loan of 1,200,000 KHR and her member is applying for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide and to pay a plowing fee for her rice farming business. She hopes to make her living better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide and to pay a plowing fee for her rice farming business.

loans.name: Seyla's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Seyla is 36 years old and a mother of two children who are in school. She strives for a living doing rice cropping as the main source of income. This returns her about 33,000 KHR per day. 

This is the eighth time loan for Seyla and the seventh time loan for her joint borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) with a successful repayment of their past loans which have improved their lives. Now, they are seeking the same loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR. As the leader, Seyla will spend her entire loan portion to pay for fertilizer and pesticide and to pay a plowing fee. She strongly hopes that her family’s income will increase.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and pesticide and to pay a plowing fee.

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en: Phat is 44 years old and a local villager from the Battambang province. She is married and blessed with two schoolchildren. To feed the family, she does rice farming and has a fish-selling business as the main sources of income which return her about 15,200 KHR per day. She has done this for 12 years. This is the seventh cycle loan for her and her co-borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). They are requesting a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. Phat has completely repaid back her past loan with success and it has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle better than before. For this cycle, she is the leader of her group. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes that her rice will produce a good crop yield for her.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Sarieng's Group

texts.en: Sarieng is a citizen from Battambang province and she is 20 year-old. She is a young mother of one son. To strive for a living she does rice farming as the main source of income and works as a paid worker for more income. She has been in this business for five years. Now she is seeking a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is a third cycle client. She is the group leader of two and she is applying for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her rice paddy. She believes that she can increase her crop yield over the last few years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio, a hardworking father of one, works at a private company as a security guard. While not on duty, he operates transportation services in their village. His wife sells used clothing in their village. The couple earns well and they save money for the future education of their child and are able to repair their house with Rogelio's generated revenue. Recently, Rogelio borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy new tires to replace the old and used ones. Hopefully in the future, Rogelio can improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy new tires.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob is a married man. He has 8 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 14 years. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a farm where he grows maize and potatoes to sell. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a good area for agriculture and his primary customers are hotels. He describes his biggest business challenge to be weather changes. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs to enable him increase production. His business goal is to be able to sustain himself within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Peninnah

texts.en: Peninnah is a married woman. She has 2 children aged 3 and 6 years. She describes herself to be sincere. She operates a farm where she grows potatoes to sell. Her primary customers are of all kinds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs to enable her to increase production. Her business goal is to have economically viable business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will sustain her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Pheap, a mother of four children, is also a farmer who grows rice in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province where she lives. Her single source of income from one hectare of rice cropping has returned her about 18,000 KHR per day to cover the daily basic needs of her entire household. 

Pheap is not a recent borrower who has just borrowed from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) once or twice, she is in a seventh cycle loan. The past loans, which she has repaid completely, have enabled her to improve her living conditions at a good pace. Now, she leads a group of four to get a new loan. The total amount requested by her entire group is 5,200,000 KHR, of which 1,400,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay a plowing fee. She hopes that her family’s situation will improve gradually.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay a plowing fee.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 41 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 24,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

Arlene has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

Arlene aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Sarim's Group

texts.en: Sarim is a 47-year-old, resident from Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are in school and one remaining too young for schooling. She earns money to support the family by farming rice and selling Khmer noodles. She has been involved with this business for 29 years. This is the second cycle loan for Sarim with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). Now, she is the group leader of two. As the leader, she is going to use her entire loan portion to buy rice and equipment to make Khmer noodles to sell. She hopes that her business will enable her to support her children to study to a high level.

loans.use: to buy rice and equipment to make Khmer noodles to sell.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies for her shop

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, fruits and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a profitable location and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital to buy more stock of the items she sells. She will use the Kes 90,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits, tomatoes and vegetables. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of kes 50,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits, tomatoes and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is a 36-year-old woman. She has one child who is 13 years old. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of shoes to sell. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Julfa

texts.en:
Julfa is 40 years old and married with seven children.  With three children in school, Julfa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell recycled materials business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Julfa has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Julfa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Maarina

texts.en: As a married parent of five children, Maarina works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Maarina is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials for her business. Maarina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Sona's Group

texts.en:
Sona, 36, is a villager of Battambang province. She is a married mother and blessed with three dependent kids, two in school and one is too young for schooling. The main source of her income is from cassava growing which she has involved for 18 years. This current business returns her 28,300 KHR per day.

She has been with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) for one past loan which has completely repayment back and improved her family living better than before. Now, she is seeking for the loan with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) and she is a leader with two borrower. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to pay for pay for plowing, labor fees and to buy fertilizer, pesticide for her field. She hopes to gain better yield in order to expand her farmland in bigger scale.

loans.use: to pay for pay for plowing, labor fees and to buy fertilizer, pesticide for her field

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en: Neang is a borrower from Kampong Cham province and she is 40 year-old. She is a mother of two children. Rice farming is the main source of income and being a paid worker brings in extra income. She has been with this business for 20 years and it has earned her 28,200 KHR per day. Now, she is the group leader of two for requesting a loan. Both of them are the first cycle clients with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is applying for a loan of 400,000 KHR each. As the leader she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide and seeds. She hopes that her rice will produce good crop yield to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and seeds

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials and certified corn seeds so that she can plant them in the future.

loans.name: Jeiner

texts.es:
Jeiner tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijo en el distrito de La Florida una comunidad de clima variado, ubicada en la Provincia de San Miguel que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores gallos, gallinas, pollos, desde hace 5 años en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y una segunda parte para la compra de variedad de animales para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jeiner is twenty-eight years old and lives together with his wife and son in the La Florida district, a community with a very varied climate.  La Florida is located in the San Miguel province and is part of the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

He makes a living raising and selling small animals, like roosters, hens, and chickens.  He has been doing this for five years in the area behind his home.  He is requesting a loan for 1,500 soles in order to purchase animal feed to fatten his animals and to buy a variety of these animals to offer his customers.

loans.use: to buy animal feed to fatten his animals.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. Elsie has been in this business for four years now. In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: Avelina works hard to support her family.  She is married, and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing materials.  Avelina has been in this business for 20 years now. In the future, Avelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Gina works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Gina is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase wood, bamboo, gasoline and fishing net for her fishing business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase wood, bamboo, gasoline and fishing net for her business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita owns and operates a tricycle service providing transportation in her community to earn a living. Her husband is the one operating it, and carrying passengers and baggage to their respective destinations. With her revenue generated from these activities, her previous loan was successfully repaid. To improve the services, she took a new loan to cover repair and maintenance costs.  She plans to use the additional profits generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to cover repair and maintenance costs for her existing tricycle.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail business where he sells sweets, sugar, candles, bread and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy area and his customers are diverse. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price inflation. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stocks of sugar, sweets, candles and other items. His business goal is to own a large shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have an economically sustainable business. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, sweets, candles and other items

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be experienced. She operates a retail business where she sells wheat flour,washing soap, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a viable place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of wheat flour, washing soap and other items. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be happy. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of wheat flour, washing soap and other items

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 43 years old and widowed with three children, one of whom is in school, Nancy works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Nancy has been in this business for 3 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de Cuyca, una zona rural del distrito de Colasay, una comunidad de clima variado con abundantes bosques verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de arroz desde hace 10 años, Irma ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para su cultivo de arroz y de esta manera tener una mayor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Irma is 39 years old and lives with her husband and children in Caserío de Cuyca, a rural area in the Colasay district. The community has varying climates and many green trees. Its population works in agriculture, business, and livestock, and it is located in the Jaén province, which is in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Perú.

Irma and her husband work in agriculture, and, specifically, they have grown rice for 10 years. Irma has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternative for 4,000 nuevos soles to buy seeds and fertilizers for rice-growing. In this way, she can have a better crop to offer her clients.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for rice-growing.

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en: Charlita is 45 years old, and married with two children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Charlita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming sugarcane for twenty years and also earns additional income from a general store and pig fattening. Charlita is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business, and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an automobile.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a multi-purpose woodwork machine.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is 45 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jona has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jona requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Jona has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Jona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es: Doña Gumercinda, tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo a su cargo y reside en el municipio del Negrito, Yoro. Hace 5 años ella decidió establecer su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende productos básicos como ser arroz, frijoles, manteca, azúcar, harina, productos de aseo, lácteos, embutidos etc. Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras con el fin de mantener surtido el negocio, comprara granos básicos, carnes, lácteos, productos de limpieza, refrescos, harina y otros que necesite para vender. Tiene como meta ampliar el local del negocio y comprar un frízer para vender carnes y obtener mas ingresos para darle el estudio a su hijo.
texts.en:
Gumercinda is forty years old and is a single mother.  She has one son and lives in the municipality of Negrito, Yoro.  Five years ago, she decided to establish her own grocery business.  She sells basic grocery items like rice, beans, butter, sugar, flour, cleaning products, milk products, snacks, etc.  

She has requested her second loan for 20,000 Lempiras to stock her business by buying basic grains, meat, milk products, cleaning products, drinks, flour, and other items that she sells.  Her goal is to grow her business premises and to buy a freezer in order to sell meat.  This will allow her to earn a higher income in order to pay her son's school expenses.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, milk products, cleaning products, drinks, flour, and other goods she needs to sell.

loans.name: Sumber Rahayu Group

texts.en:
The Sumber Rahayu group paid off their loan of 15,000,000 on time, managed by the head, Ni Luh. 

Ni Luh says she has had good progress in her business. The sows gave birth to 10 - 15 healthy piglets each. She had a big harvest. After keeping the piglets for one month, she sold them all for 275,000 IDR each. Ni Luh made a profit of 3,750,000 IDR, and she’s very happy for that. Now she can pay the bills, fulfill the family’s needs and save. Most of the group members have had a good result, and they decided to take a new loan.

The group is receiving the same loan size, and there’s nothing changed in the composition of the board and members. The loan will be used to increase the population of pigs and also purchase feed. 

Ni Luh succeeds in breeding sows and piglets, so she will use her loan to purchase superior feed and renovate the cage for newborn piglets. Now she plans to sell the piglets to another breeder in another village in order to get more profit. She hopes her plans run smoothly.

loans.use: to purchase superior feed and renovate the cage for newborn piglets.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is forty-nine years old and has only one child. She is a kind and diligent mother.

Erlina runs a small variety store within the local community to supplement her husband's income. She aims to make her business profitable in order to generate sufficient income. She wants to acquire more grocery items to sell but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she is seeking a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy more rice, fish, canned goods, snack foods, noodles, seasoning and beverages to sell. In future, In future, she believes that she will make more improvements to the business.

loans.use: to buy rice, fish, canned goods, snack foods, noodles, seasonings and beverages to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria manages her own farm located in the village of Gata Diot Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is also a farmer, and they plant corn and bananas to earn a living. With her generated income from farming, she has successfully repaid her previous loans, and has provided for household expenditures. Expanding the farm costs a lot of money. To finance land preparation costs for farm expansion, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit in order to increase her income. She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to finance land preparation costs for farm expansion.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron bars, blocks, and piedrin.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be experienced. She operates a retail business where she sells bananas, onions, carrots and other items. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a viable place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of bananas, onions and other items. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be a happy business lady. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas, onions and other items to sell

loans.name: Patricio Wladimir

texts.es: Patricio es un joven soltero de 24 años de edad, él vive  con sus padres y 2 de sus 4 hermanos,  Patricio se dedica a cultivar papas desde que tenía 14 años ya que su padre tambien se dedica a la agricultura y su madre se dedica a trabajar al campo, el joven es muy responsable y cuida bien sus cultivos para esto paga a tres personas que le ayuden y de igual manera le ayuda su padre, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono y fungicidas para sus cultivos, los sueños de Patricio es incrementar sus cultivos para mejorar sus ingresos  para solventar sus gastos  y ayudar a cubrir los gastos que tienen sus padres.
texts.en:
Patricio is a single 24 year old man.  He lives with his parents and two of his four siblings.  Patricio has worked growing potatoes since he was 14 years old since his father also works in agriculture and his mother works in the field.  The young man is very responsible and takes good care of his crops.  He pays three people who help him, and he also helps his father.

Patricio will use his loan to purchase seed and manure.  His dreams are to expand his crops to increase his earnings and cover his expenses, and to help cover his parents' expenses.

loans.use: purchase seed and manure.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es:
María Cecilia tiene 54 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotun, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace 15 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos de belleza cremas hidratantes, perfumes, cosméticos, para ofrecer a sus clientes que en la mayoría son mujeres.
texts.en:
María Cecilia is 54 years old and lives with her husband and children in the district of Oyotun, which is a community that works in agriculture, business, and livestock, located in the Chiclayo province, which is in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú.

She has sold beauty products for 15 years, and her business is located in her home. She has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy a variety of hydrating beauty creams, perfumes, and cosmetics to offer her clients, the majority of whom are female.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beauty products.

loans.name: Selestine

texts.en: Selestine is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her customers are diverse. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more fish to sell. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to meet family needs.

loans.use: buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seats and tables for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle for his transport business

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
Fermin tiene 64 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El tiene una bodeguita, donde se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, huevos, menestras, desde hace más de 3 años, su hijo le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería sacos de arroz, azúcar, aceite para hacer crecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Fermin is 64 years old and lives with his son in the District of Oyotún. The people who live in this rural area engage in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. This community is located in Chiclayo Province, which is part of the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

Fermin has a small store where he sells groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, eggs, and stews. He has been managing this business for more than three years and his son helps with the work. Fermin is requesting a loan in the amount of 500 PEN in order to buy a large quantity of merchandise, including sacks of rice, sugar, and oil. This will enable him to grow his business and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Analosa

texts.en:
Analosa is a 24-year-old  woman with three children. She runs a small business of selling pancakes in her community, and she has been doing this for three years. Analosa has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a bottle of vegetable oil, yeast, a sack of sugar, plastic bags, a gas stove, a fry pan and a wooden spoon to help her with her pancake business. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Analosa will use her earnings to help her family with everyday needs and to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a bottle of vegetable oil, yeast, a sack of sugar, plastic bags, a gas stove, fry pan and wooden spoon

loans.name: Onorio

texts.es:
Onorio tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El tiene una pequeña panadería donde prepara el pan de manera artesanal, el se dedica a esta labor desde hace 3 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de insumos para la elaboración de panes para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Onorio is 47 years old and lives with his wife and children in the district of Oyotun, a community dedicated to agriculture, commerce, and cattle raising, located in the Province of Chiclayo, a part of the Lambayeque region, on Peru's north coast.

Onorio has a small bakery where he prepares bread in an artisan manner. He has dedicated himself to this work for 3 years.

Onorio is requesting a loan of 1,500 new sols in order to purchase a variety of supplies for making more of his bread to offer customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of supplies for baking bread.

loans.name: Yishimi

texts.es:
Yishimi tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en La Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la fabricación de puertas, armarios, ventanas en aluminio desde hace un año aproximadamente, cuenta con clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de material de trabajo aluminio y de esta manera seguir brindando este servicio.
texts.en:
Yishimi is forty-two years old and lives together with his wife and children in the district of Cayaltí.  Members of this community make a living in agriculture, trade, and livestock.  Cayaltí is located in the Chiclayo province, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

He works making doors, cupboards, and windows out of aluminum.  He has been doing this for about a year, and already has a considerable customer base.  He is requesting a loan for 1,000 soles in order to purchase aluminum material.  In doing this, he will be able to continue offering his services.

loans.use: to buy aluminum in order to make doors and windows.

loans.name: Consorcia

texts.es:
Consorcia tiene 55 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado caprino, las compras lo realiza en caseríos aledaños y las venta lo realiza en su domicilio ya que cuenta con un comprador de Jaén, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de un torete para posteriormente engordarlo y ofrecerlo a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Consorcia is 55 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Pucará district, a community that works in agriculture, business, and livestock, located in the Jaén province, which is in the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú.

She raises and sells goats. She purchases the goats in neighboring villages and sells them in her home, since she can count on a buyer in Jaén. She has requested a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy a young bull to raise and sell at a better price.

loans.use: to buy a young bull to raise and sell at a better price.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 60 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming bananas in the Philippines. Cecilia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Cecilia has been farming bananas for 15 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell.

Daisy has been in this business for seven years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. Rosalinda is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for two years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net for her business

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Rachel works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rachel is borrowing 21,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy more stock of clothing to sell.

Rachel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sherill

texts.en: Sherill is 29 years old, and married with one child.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, chips, and soft drinks. Sherill has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years, and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.  She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, chips, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Wilberforce

texts.en: Wilberforce is thirty years old and married with two children. He operates a barber shop which he started in 2010 to employ himself. He also earns extra income by charging phones. He needs a loan to buy a solar charging system plus machines to use in his barbershop. Although Wilberforce faces great competition, he hopes to expand his business in the future and own more barber shops, so that he can earn more income.

loans.use: buy a solar charging system plus machines to use in his barbershop.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, aged 37, is a responsible father of five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He practices tea farming, a business he has been running since 2003, having started it to increase his income. He is also a mechanic and sells spare parts to add onto his earnings; he concentrates on this during the dry season when the tea business does poorly. 

He is requesting a loan to rent another tea plantation so as to increase his output. George hopes to see his children attain education to higher levels.

loans.use: to rent another tea plantation so as to increase his ouput.

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
Arnaldo tiene 22 años de edad, vive en el Caserío El Tambillo, una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás, una comunidad de clima variado, con abundantes bosques, su población se dedica a a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café de la variedad catimor, también se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, su esposa le apoya en esta labor ordeñando al ganado lechero para posteriormente vender la leche fresca quesillos que elabora artesanalmente, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para el pago de mantenimiento de su cultivo de cafeto y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Arnaldo is twenty-two years old.  He lives in the small town of El Tambillo, a rural community in the district of Santo Tomás.  Here, the climate is very varied and there are abundant forests.  The people here make a living in agriculture, trade, and livestock.  The town is located in the Cutervo province and belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. 

Arnaldo makes a living in agriculture, particularly in cultivating Catimor coffee.  He also raises cattle.  His wife supports him in this work by milking the cows so that they may sell fresh milk and cheese.

He has requested a loan for 3,000 soles, which he will use to pay for his coffee crop maintenance.  This will allow him to generate greater income for his family.

loans.use: to pay the day laborers for their work in maintaining his coffee crops.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 35 years old and a mother of three. Due to the hardship of living, she helps her husband in cultivating their farmland and also in mushroom production to ensure a high production. 

They aim to improve their farming business and mushroom production in order for them to earn sufficient income. Having inadequate capital, Alma is seeking an additional loan of PHP 10,000 to buy plastic roll, cogon (a kind of grass) and banana leaves needed in growing mushrooms. 

She hopes that someday they will improve their farming business and their status of living through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy plastic roll, cogon (a kind of grass) and banana leaves needed in mushroom production.

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
Otila tiene 58 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza y piqueos en la zona, cuenta con clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de cerveza para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Otilia is 58 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Buenos Aires district, a community that works in agriculture, business, and livestock, located in the Morropon province, which is in the Piura region, on the northern coast of Perú.

She sells beer and snacks in the area, and she has a large clientele. She has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy more beer to offer her clients and, in this way, to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy more beer to offer her clients.

loans.name: Mirian Jessica

texts.es:
Mirian Jessica tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales,gallos, gallinas, pollos, en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un prestamo de 1 600 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Mirian Jessica is 30 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Oyotún district, a community that works in agriculture, business, and livestock, located in the Chiclayo province, which is in the Lambayeque region on the northern cost of Perú.

She raises and sells animals, including roosters, hens, and chickens behind her house. She has requested a loan of 1,600 nuevos soles to buy nutritious food to fatten her animals and, in this way, to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy nutritious food to fatten her animals.

loans.name: Martha Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña Martha es originaria de Managua, casada y madre de tres hijos ya independientes. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de mercadería variada. Se siente agradecida con KIVA y MiCrédito ya que con el crédito logro incrementar su inventario y mejorar sus ventas. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Artículos escolares, Cosméticos, Cremas entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá abastecer la demanda de sus clientes y obtener así mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Martha is from Managua.  She is married and has three children who are now independent.  She is a merchant, and she sells varied merchandise.

She is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito because, with the loan, she managed to increase her inventory and improve her sales.

She is requesting the loan to buy school items, cosmetics, creams, and others.  She believes that the loan will be a big help because she will be able to meet the demand of her customers.  This way she will get better earnings.

loans.use: to buy school items, cosmetics, creams, and others.

loans.name: Maa Maheswari Shg (A) Group

texts.en:
In 2012, eleven women from a small village stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their families; they formed a group named “Maa Maheswari Self Help Group”. The members of Maa Maheswari SHG are all women from the district of Sonepur in Odisha, India.

One of them is Mrs. Kaushalya, who was selected as their president. The lady standing with her hand raised in the photo is Kaushalya. Kaushalya is 48 years old and is staying with her husband and her two children. Her husband has been involved in vegetable and paddy farming for a long time. 

She got the idea of doing vegetable cultivation from her husband, so she gathered some other women from her neighborhood and told them about her plan. They liked her idea and appreciated her. She took the leadership of the group and started to cultivate vegetables and sell them in her village. She took some land for lease and started vegetable cultivation on a small scale. She started with a limited supply of vegetables like tomatoes and potatoes and grew to sell more than seven varieties like brinjal (eggplant), cucumbers, beans, carrots, and radishes. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village, as she sells fresh and high-quality vegetables.

She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. Now she has a new idea of doing sugarcane cultivation, for which she has requested a loan to utilize for the resources necessary to do sugarcane cultivation. A portion of the loan amount will help her to purchase sugarcane plants, fertilizers and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labor charges

loans.use: to pay for resources like sugarcane plants, fertilizers and insecticides for her sugarcane plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer to help her sugar cane crops.

loans.name: Yusifu

texts.en:
Yusuf, aged 40, is a father of three. He is engaged in shoe selling, a business he has run for seven years. He started the business to earn a living using the little savings from the salary he was earning from cattle keeping. He also carries out tomato farming to increase his income. 

He needs a loan to buy more shoes to sell. Yusuf is challenged by high transport costs and the unpredictable weather changes that affect his farming business, but hopes to expand his business to a better and desirable state.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Rosa America

texts.es:
Rosa America tiene 36 años de edad,vive junto a su esposo e hijos een el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, coemrcio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza y chicha de jora, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un prestamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de cerveza para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa America is 36 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Buenos Aires district, a community that works in agriculture, business, and livestock, located in the Morropon province, which is in the Piua region on the northern coast of Perú.

She sells beer and traditional Peruvian corn beer. Her business is located in her home. She has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to buy more beer to offer her clients and, in this way, to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy more beer to offer her clients.

loans.name: Ahoudou

texts.fr: Ahoudou est  une jeune femme de 38 ans marié père d'un enfant. Après sa formation, il a ouvert un petit atelier de couture qui fonctionne bien depuis 1 ans déjà, mais n'a pas tout le matériel pour aller plus vite avec ses commandes et pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle à temps. C'est pour celà qu'elle sollicite un crédit pour s'acheter des tissus et le petit matériel de coutures (épingles, aiguilles, doublure, fil...) qui l'évitera d'aller au marché tout le temps, il pourra coudre et revendre à ses clients. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit lui permettra non seulement de s'acheter son petit matériel de couture pour agrandir son activité, mais aussi de satisfaire certains de ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ahoudou is a 38-year-old, married father of one child.  Following his training, he opened a small sewing workshop which has been operating well for one year.  Unfortunately, he doesn't have all the necessary supplies to fulfil his orders quickly enough to satisfy his customers.  This is why he has requested this loan, to buy fabric and other necessary supplies (pins, needles, lining, thread, etc).  Larger stock levels will enable him to focus on work and not have to go to the market as frequently.

Ahoudou will use the profits from this loan to buy further stock, provide for certain personal needs and provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth es una joven de 22 años, estudiante universitaria de diseño gráfico, soñadora y emprendedora que desde hace 5 años aprendió el arte de la fotografía por medio de un amigo que tiene una microempresa con esta actividad. Desde hace 7 meses alterna sus estudios realizando trabajos de fotografía de manera  independiente en eventos sociales, fiestas de quinces, matrimonios y graduaciones pero su mayor desventaja es que hace el trabajo con equipos de fotografía alquilados, lo que disminuye su rentabilidad por el alto costo que debe pagar por el alquiler de dichos equipos. Elizabeth sueña con tener su propio estudio de fotografía para no gastar más dinero en alquiler de equipos y terminar sus estudios, es por ello que se motiva para solicitar un préstamo el cual utilizará para comprar su equipo profesional como (cámara fotográfica profesional, lentes, trípodes) y de esta manera prestar un excelente servicio en todos los eventos mientras percibe un aumento en sus ingresos, con lo cual podrá culminar su carrera profesional como diseñadora gráfica y ver su sueño cumplido.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 22 years old and a university student studying Graphic Design. She is a dreamer and entrepreneur who 5 years ago learned the art of photography from a friend who has a micro-business in this field. For the past 7 months she has been alternating her studies with free-lance photography work at social events, fifteen year old birthday celebrations, weddings and graduations. Her disadvantage is that she is using rented equipment to work. Because of the high cost of renting the equipment her profits are hurt. 

Elizabeth dreams of having her own photography studio so as to not spend more money on renting equipment. She also wants to finish her studies. So she is requesting a loan which she will use to purchase her professional equipment like a camera, lenses and tripod. In this way she can provide excellent service at all the events and see her profits increase. Then she can crown her professional career as a graphic designer and fulfill her dream.

loans.use: to buy professional equipment like a camera, lenses and tripod.

loans.name: Blaise Constant

texts.fr: Blaise est un jeune homme de 34 ans chef de famille ayant des enfants en charge. il fait dans la vente des chaussures dans un marché de la place. A cause de la petitesse de son capital, il est confronté régulièrement aux problème de rupture de stock. raison pour laquelle il sollicite un crédit pour augmenter le stock de sa marchandise afin de mieux gérer son petit commerce et de se  faire des bénéfices. lesquelles lui permettront de de faire grandir son activité et de s'occuper de sa petite famille. à la longue il a un projet de construction d'une maison familiale.
texts.en:
Blaise is a 34-year-old man with a family and a few children in his care.  He sells shoes at a local market. 

Because of his limited capital, he often runs out-of-stock.  He has therefore requested this loan to increase his stock of shoes, which will help him to better manage his small retail business and make more profit.  This profit will help him to grow his business and to take care of his family.  

In the long term, he plans to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock of shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inventory (underwear, accessories, and other items) at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soybean skin and fodder for her milk cow.

loans.name: José Ángel

texts.es: José con 45 años de edad, es casado y con 5 hijos, viven en una zona rural, durante toda su vida estuvo trabajando cerca de sus padres y aprendió las actividades diversas del campo como el cultivo de hortalizas y verduras además de la cría y cuidado de vacas lecheras para su vender el producto adquirido, aún sigue en forma independiente trabajando con la lechería y en sus ratos libres con el cultivo de uchuva, fríjol y otros productos. José sueña con tener muchas vacas productoras de leche y que sus cultivos sea más extensos para mayor producción, es por ello que solicita el crédito con el cual comprará dos vacas lecheras de buena raza y también se surtirá de insumos para el cultivo como son (fungicidas, abonos, semillas y otros); esto le permitirá mejorar el nivel de vida de toda su familia, como resultado del aumento en la producción de leche para satisfacer la gran demanda del producto en estas regiones.
texts.en:
José, 45, is married with five children. They live in a rural area. He has worked his whole life close to his parents, learning the different activities of the countryside such as how to cultivate vegetables and products from the garden, as well as how to raise and take care of dairy cows in order to sell the products acquired from them. He is still working independently on the dairy farm and in his free time, cultivating gooseberries, beans, and other products. 

José dreams of having many dairy cows and expanding his crops for greater production, which is why he is requesting a loan with which he will buy two dairy cows of a good breed, and stock up on supplies for cultivation, such as fungicide, fertilizer, seeds and more. As a result of the increase in milk production, he will help satisfy the great demand for this product in these regions, and this will allow him to improve his whole family´s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows of a good breed as well as supplies for cultivation, such as fungicide, fertilizer, seeds, and more

loans.name: Natali

texts.es: La señora Natali de 22 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora, vive en el municipio de Monteagudo en un  domicilio en alquiler, su actividad principal es la confección de ropa de vestir  de las cuales genera sus ingresos, tiene 1 hijo que depende de ella y vive con su esposo quien trabaja en la actividad de albañil. Ambos son muy responsables con sus actividades. Actualmente solicita un crédito que lo destinara para la compra de máquinas industriales overlock y materia prima para confección de prendas de vestir, además de adquirir materia prima para la confección de cortinas, como en su municipio no se cuenta específicamente con esta actividad ella podrá ampliar sus trabajos de confecciones de ropa de vestir y generar mayores ingresos de su actividad y así podrá tener mejores condiciones de vida por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Natali is 22 years old and is a very hard-working person. She lives in the Monteagudo municipality in a rented house. She makes clothing, from which she generates income. She has one son that depends on her, and she lives with her husband, who is a construction worker. Both are very responsible. At present, she is requesting a loan that she will use to buy overlock machines and raw materials to make clothing, in addition to acquiring raw material to make curtains. As her municipality does not current have this specific activity, she will be able to grow her business and earn more income. In this way, she will be able to improve her quality of life for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy overlock machines and raw materials.

loans.name: Justice Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bénita est une  brave commerçante et membre d’un groupe d’affaires « Justice A », senior  entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 57 ans et mère de 13 enfants dont 8 étudient et 5 sont déjà maries.  La cliente est une vendeuse des pagnes de meilleure qualité. Elle installe ses marchandises dans le marché animé de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari. Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l’administration publique. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 29 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 7 pièces de pagnes. Ainsi, elle souhaite  scolariser, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Bénita is a courageous trader, and a member of the business group, 'Justice A'.  She is a dynamic, senior entrepreneur, 57 years old and mother to thirteen children.  Eight of her children currently attend school and five are already married.  

Bénita sells the highest quality pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) at a busy local market.  She started her business with the help of her husband who is a public administrator.  Later on, she started working with the field partner, Hekima.  She has been running her business for 29 years.

This new loan will be used to buy seven pagnes and Bénita will use her earnings to educate and feed her children.

Bénita is very grateful to Hekima for helping non-bankable, women entrepreneurs become independent.  This is especially important in this critical post-conflict time in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 7 pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to finish constructing a packing room and to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: William  Enrique

texts.es:
El es William Enrique, tiene 19 años, estudio la primaria y el bachillerato en el Colegio Rafael Uribe Uribe, vive con los papas y el hermanito.
El papa es conductor de servicio público, la mama es ama de casa y a veces trabaja por días, el hermanito esta cursando sexto en el mismo colegio donde el se gradúo.
En el año 2011 cuando se gradúo, al año siguiente entro a otro instituto a estudiar  Auxiliar de Enfermería, pero le toco retirarse al comenzar el segundo semestre por problemas económicos.
Entro a trabajar en marroquinería, allí el trabajo era tiempo completo, con lo que ahorro se pudo matricular en CAMPO ALTO para volver a estudiar Auxiliar de Enfermería, en esta sede se puedo ir a pie con eso ahorra lo de los pasajes.
Además trabaja en construcción, en un lavadero de noche; no solo para el sino para ayudar en la casa , porque la situación económica a veces es un poco difícil y la mama y el se rebuscan para ayudarle a el papa.
El mayor anhelo es culminar los estudios y presentarse al Ejército porque quiere ser soldado y servirle a la Patria en el campo de la salud, le gustaría viajar a  los pueblos a realizar campañas de salud.

Le gusta la enfermería por que es una carrera bonita, amena, le gusta por que es técnica y practica, se siento complacido y a gusto con lo que aprendo cada día.
Además de la enfermería le encanta jugar fútbol y cada vez que puede va al parque el Tunal el día domingo a practicarlo.
Los sueños no terminan ahí, le gustaría en algún momento de la vida y espera que no sea muy lejano estudiar medicina y especializarse en medico cirujano.
Estaría muy agradecido si kiva lo beneficia con el subsidio estudiantil  al cual se esta postulando, esto le seria mas fácil poder conseguir  el resto de dinero y así poder culminar este semestre .

El sabe que nada en la vida es fácil, pero mientras  tenga las ganas y luche por realizar  los sueños y mas cuando les dan las posibilidades y la oportunidad de llevarlo a cabo, tiene que agradecer demostrando que  no le ha fallado ni a los demás ni a el mismo con buen nivel académico y disciplinario.
texts.en:
William Enrique, 19, went to elementary school and high school at Colegio Rafael Uribe Uribe.  He lives with his parents and his younger brother.  His father works as a driver for public services and his mother's a homemaker who sometimes works during the day.  His younger brother is in sixth grade at the same school from which William Enrique graduated.

William Enrique began studying to be a nurse's assistant in another school the year after he graduated in 2011.  He had to withdraw at the beginning of his second semester, though, because of financial problems.  He started working a full-time job in the leather industry.  With the money he was able to save he registered at CampoAlto to go back to studying to be a nurse's assistant.  He could walk to school so he saved on transportation.

He also works construction in a laundry at night.  He works for himself as well as to help out at home.  The economic situation is sometimes difficult, so he and his mother look for ways to help his father.

His greatest desire is to finish his studies and join the army because he wants to be a soldier and serve his country in the health field.  He would like to travel to small towns on health campaigns.

He likes nursing because it's a nice and enjoyable field of study.  It's technical and practical, and he's contented with what he learns every day.  In addition to nursing he loves to play soccer, and he plays on Sunday at El Tunal Park whenever he can.

William Enrique's dreams don't stop there.  He would like to study medicine some day in the not-too-distant future and specialize in medical surgery.

He would be very grateful if Kiva grants him the student subsidy for which he's applying.  This would make it very easy for him to be able to get the rest of the money to finish this semester.

He knows that nothing in life is easy.  He wants to strive to achieve his dreams, and even more so when he he's given the opportunity.  He will show his gratitude by maintaining a good academic standing and disciplinary record so as not to disappoint himself or others.

loans.use: to pay his tuition for a semester

loans.name: Melchelor

texts.fr: Melchelor est un homme de 41 ans fiancé père de 3 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 3 mois et 09 ans. Il est commerçant et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (maniocs, plantains, noix de palmes et fruits) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 05 ans. Il a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais il se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'il est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Il souhaitera acheter un pick up des régimes de plantains pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Il économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Melchelor is 41 years old, engaged to be married and father to three children between three months and nine years old.  He has been selling fresh, seasonal produce (cassava, plantains, palm nuts and fruit) at a local market for five years.  He knows his suppliers and customers very well, and has built up the latter over the years thanks to his experience in his business.

Unfortunately, he often runs out of stock as he must sell all his produce before he can buy more, due to his limited capital levels.  He would like to buy a truck load of plantains to increase his stock levels, satisfy the steady demand of his customers and avoid running out of stock.

Melchelor will save his earnings and use them to expand his business and provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy a truck load of plantains for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy men´s and women´s clothing

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor es un hombre trabajador y pujante, que se ha ganado la vida trabajando como conductor de bus de servicio público, labor que ha realizado durante muchos años y que le permitió generar ingresos para solventar los gastos básicos de su familia y brindar educación a sus dos hijos. Desde hace 1 mes se quedó sin empleo y por ello comenzó a fabricar lavaderos y posetas en granito y cemento, oficio que aprendió con algunos familiares cuando era muy joven; la producción es vendida en diferentes depósitos y almacenes de artículos para el hogar dentro y fuera de la ciudad.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos al por mayor (cemento, granito, aluminio), esto le permitirá aumentar su producción para satisfacer la demanda actual y mejorar los ingresos para sustentar las necesidades familiares.
Víctor manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es lograr acreditar y fortalecer su negocio para hacer de éste una fuente rentable de ingresos que le permita brindar una mejor educación  a sus hijos y seguir velando por el bienestar y una mejor calidad de vida para toda la familia.
texts.en:
Víctor is a hard-working, energetic man who made a living working as a public service bus driver for many years, and that allowed him to generate an income to take care of his family´s basic expenses and provide his two children with an education. A month ago he lost his job and for that reason, he began fabricating cement and granite sinks and wash basins, work he learned to do with some family members when he was very young. His products are sold in different warehouses and stores selling items for the home, within and outside the city.

He is requesting the loan to invest it in the purchase of wholesale supplies (cement, granite, aluminum), which will allow him to increase his production to satisfy current demand and improve his income to cover his family´s needs. Víctor states that his greatest desire is to be able to strengthen and improve the credibility of his business, to make it a profitable source of income that allows him to provide his children with a better education, and continue ensuring the welfare and quality of life of his whole family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies (cement, granite, aluminum)

loans.name: Cholponay

texts.ru: Чолпонай, 43 года, не замужем, имеет 2 детей.  Чолпонай более 20 лет занимается пошивом женской одежды, а также костюмов для театральной сцены. В данное время работа идет полным ходом, в основном по заказу, имеет постоянных заказчиков. Бизнес очень хороший, а самое главное Чолпонай с удовольствием занимается своей работой-шитьем, которое приносит ей ежемесячный доход в сумме 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чолпонай обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом- на покупку новой инновационной швейной машинки, а также материалов для производства женской одежды. На доходы от кредита Чолпонай хочет увеличить товарооборот и благоустроить жилье.
texts.en: Cholponay is 43 years old and is not married. She has two children. For more than 20 years, Cholponay has been sewing women's clothing as well as costumes for theatrical productions. Her business is currently running at full speed. She primarily takes orders for pieces and has loyal ordering customers. It is a very good business, but most importantly, Cholponay really enjoys doing it. Her sewing business brings her an average monthly income of 9,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Cholponay turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy a new, innovative sewing machine and materials for making women's clothing. Cholponay plans to invest the earnings from the loan to increase sales turnover and to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and materials for sewing women's clothes.

loans.name: Mohamadou

texts.fr: Mouhamadou est une femme de 44 ans mariée mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 14 et 23 ans.  Elle a ouvert un restaurant qu'elle gère depuis des années. c'est grâce à lui qu'elle s'occupe de sa famille. Le fait d'acheter les produit de restauration en détail ne rapporte vraiment grand chose pour elle. D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'augmenter le stock de ses denrées alimentaires (sacs de d'arachide, du haricot, 1 sac de riz et le petit nécessaire pour cuisiner ses plats. Cela lui évitera les déplacements quotidiens et diminuera ses frais de taxi, ça augmentera aussi ses bénéfices. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce profit pour agrandir son restaurant, l'autre l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mouhamadou is 44 years old, married and mother to three children between 14 and 23 years old.  Many years ago, she opened a restaurant and she has been running it ever since.  Thanks to her business, she is able to provide for her family.  However, buying her ingredients on a retail basis limits her profits.  This is why Mouhamadou is requesting this loan.  She would like to be able to buy larger quantities of food (sacks of peanuts, beans, one sack of rice and various other items) to build up her stock levels.  This would avoid her having to take a taxi every day to buy supplies, and would result in higher profits.

Mouhamadou will reinvest her earnings to expand her restaurant and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, peanuts, beans and other ingredients needed to cook her meals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase display cases, shelving and wholesale stock (notebooks, pencils, bookmarks, cardboard and other items).

loans.name: Refuge De Dumas 1 & 2 Group

texts.fr:
Cantave est le coordinateur de son groupe Refuge de Dumas 1 & 2. Il est marié mais il a 5 enfants. Cantave habite dans la ville de Dumas d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Cantave a dirigé son business pendant les 8 dernières années. Avant de commencer ce commerce, Il etait a l’ecole. 

Cantave voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat des boeufs. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Des autres membres de les refuge ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et du poisson. 

Il dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant. Il dit que ses buts principals sont l’augmantation du bussiness. Son rêve est l’achat d’une camion pour transporter les animaux.
texts.en:
Cantave is the group coordinator for the 'Refuge de Dumas 1 & 2' Group.  He is married, has five children and lives in the town of Dumas in Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very scarce.

Cantave left school eight years ago and has been running his business ever since.  He will use his loan to buy cattle, and hopes this will enable him to expand his business.  The other members of the group will use their loans to support sales businesses such as charcoal, rice and fish.

Cantave says that his biggest challenge is a lack of reliable customers.  His dream is to expand his business and buy a truck to transport his livestock.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Trinite Group

texts.fr:
Lucina est le coordinatrice de son groupe Trinite. Elle est veuve. Elle habite dans la région de Trou du Nord d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Lucina a dirigé son commerce de produit Divers pendant les 2 dernières années. Elle reçoit son troisième prêt.

Lucina voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans son commerce. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Les autres membres de ce meme groupe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour les commerces tels que charbon, vètement usage, ect. Lucina dit que son but principale c´est d'avoir entreprise florissante.
texts.en:
Lucina is the coordinator of her group 'Trinite'.  She is a widow and lives in the Trou du Nord region of Haiti where electricity is rare and water is very scarce.  Lucina has been running her sales business for two years, and she sells various products.  This will be her third loan, she will use it to invest in her business.  She hopes that she will be able to expand her operations.

The other members of the group will use their loans to support their sales businesses such as charcoal and second-hand clothing.

Lucina says that her primary aim is to have a flourishing business.

loans.use: to buy various products (cosmetics, clothing, shoes) for resale.

loans.name: María Silvana

texts.es: María es una mujer de 50 años, muy trabajadora y quien desde hace 8 años, en el momento de su separación se ve obligada a buscar una fuente de ingresos para ella y sus dos hijos, por lo cual se dedicó a la venta de mercancía por catálogo y venta de ropa por encargo. Ella piensa invertir el crédito en la compra de más mercancía como accesorios, perfumería, ropa, cosméticos y otros productos, con el fin de tener buen surtido para la época de semana santa. Sueña con montar una miscelánea y con tener casa propia, además de incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en: María is a 50 year woman, very hard working, and who 8 years ago, from the moment of her separation, was obligated to look for a source of income for her and her two children. For this she worked in the sale of catalog merchandise and special order clothing sales. She hopes to invest the loan in the purchase of more merchandise like accessories, perfume, clothes, cosmetics, and other products with the goal of having a good selection for holy week. She dreams of having a corner store and her own house in addition to increasing her income and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like accessories, perfume, clothes, cosmetics, and other products.

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.en:
Eloisa, 41 years of age, is married and blessed with four children. She owns and has managed a retail store in her village for almost eight years, earning a net income of 400 Philippine pesos (PHP) daily. Her net income is usually spent on school fees and allowances of her children.

Due to insufficient capital in her business, Eloisa would like a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase beverages, canned goods, food seasonings, and soaps to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, canned goods, food seasonings, and soaps to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries and other goods.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth es una joven mujer de 27 años, soltera y emprendedora madre de un niño de 8 años, quien hace ocho meses inició una tienda de abarrotes y verduras en su barrio, con el fin de darle estudios a su hijo. Ella quiere invertir el crédito en la compra de surtido más variado (granos y carnes frías), para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes mejores servicios en el mismo lugar. Elizabeth sueña con ampliar su negocio y mejorar las instalaciones del mismo, lo que le podrá mejorar sus ingresos para el sustento propio y de su familia.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 27, is an enterprising young woman. She is a single mother of an 8 year old boy. Eight months ago, she set up a grocery and vegetable shop in her neighborhood, with the goal of being able to send her son to school. 

Elizabeth wants to use the loan to buy a greater variety of goods (grains and meats) in order to provide her customers with better services in the same place. She hopes to expand her business and improve the shop, which will allow her to increase her income and support herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of goods (grains and meats).

loans.name: Yayra

texts.ru: Яйра обратилась за кредитом, потому что хочет начать новый бизнес в сфере торговли. Она решила открыть лавку по продаже электротоваров. Она только начинает бизнес и Яйра вначале закупает только алюминиевые и медовые провода от 1,5-10мм сечения. До недавних пор Яйра занималась шитьем национальных платьев. Чтобы помочь мужу покрыть семейные расходы, начала новую деятельность. Муж Яйры работает продавцом в магазине. Яйра очень надеется на Вашу поддержку и верит, что новая деятельность принесет хорошую прибыль и ее у ее семьи нормализуется финансовое положение.
texts.en: Yayra is requesting a loan because she wants to start a new business in the field of retail. She decided to open a small shop to sell electrical products.  She is just starting her business and to begin with, she is only buying aluminum and copper wires with a cross-section measurement between 1.5 and 10 millimeters. Up until recently, Yayra was in the business of sewing ethnic Tajik dresses. In order to help her husband cover their family's expenses, she began her new business. Yayra's husband works as a salesperson in a store. Yayra really relies on your support and believes that this new business will bring in a good profit and normalize her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy aluminum and copper wires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries and provisions (dairy products, meats, sweets, and others).

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Heriberto es una persona luchadora,que se dedica al comercio de arpas guitarras y demás, con mucho sacrificio esta saliendo adelante y comenta que por medio de la ayuda de kiva ha ido mejorando bastante, ya que sus prestamos anteriores le han sido de mucha ayuda.
Este es su tercer prestamo y lo pide para poder invertirlo en la compra de guitarras, arpas y demás instrumentos para poder seguir trabajando en su plan de negocios.
texts.en:
Heriberto is a hardworking person who works selling harps, guitars, and other items.  With a lot of sacrifice, he has gotten ahead and says that the help of Kiva has helped him improve a lot.  His previous loans have been a lot of help.  

This is his third loan.  He wants to purchase guitars, harps, and other instruments to continue working on his business plan.

loans.use: to buy guitars, harps, and other instruments.

loans.name: Demetrio
