The current business earns her about 20,000KHR per day to support her family. 

This micro loan is for Pach’s group of four members who are all female, and this is her ninth loan with VisionFund. Her past loans, all repaid, have helped  relieve her financial burden and improve her livelihood. Pach will use her portion of this loan to buy seeds for her farmland and pay labor fees. She hopes to make more income from her paddy field.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Mukarama

texts.en:
Mukarama was born in year 1961. She is a hardworking and smart woman. Mukarama is married and has two children. Her children are adults. Mukarama’s husband is a migrant in Russia. Mukarama has her own business deal. She sells women’s clothes at a local market. She has her own selling place. 

Mukarama tires for the well being of her children. Her daughter Mavzuna studies at the Medical collage. Mukarama must pay for her tuition, but she doesn't have enough money. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni (TJS) to pay for tuition of her daughter. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition of her daughter.

loans.name: Doricas

texts.en:
Doricas lives and does farming in Kitale area of North rift Kenya. She is married and has been blessed with four children, all are at school going age. She has been doing farming for seven years, where her primary sources of income are milk, eggs, crops, and a retail business. Her biggest challenge in farming is bad weather.

Doricas chose Juhudi Kilimo because they do finance farmers with money for farm assets at a low interest rate. During the training, she learned about proper farming techniques. This loan will enable her to purchase more farm inputs for her livestock, which will produce more and lead to more income and more food for her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for her livestock.

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Channa, 31 years old, is married and has four kids. She lives with her husband in a rural village in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She and her husband earn a living through planting rice and working for others for a fee. Together, they can earn about 38,000 KHR per day from the current business and manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting expenses.

Channa has been with VisionFund for two cycles. The past loans that she successfully paid back have helped her family support the business and improve their living conditions. Channa is now leading her group to ask for a loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland and pay labor fees. She hopes to increase her family’s income to improve off her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers and to pay labor fees

loans.name: Imiliano

texts.es:
Imiliano vive en la ciudad de Aguaytia, es un hombre muy trabajador, sobre todo porque es padre de familia, su hijo tiene tan solo un añito y a Imiliano le llena de orgullo, es por ello que cada día trabaja como agricultor, actualmente ha sembrado piña y lleva en este oficio alrededor de 4 años.

Imiliano está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes y dar mantenimiento al cultivo de esta manera podrá tener un cultivo que se desarrolle en buenas condicione y así tendrá una buena cosecha, de esta manera el seguirá trabajando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” tener una parcela propia”.
texts.en:
Imiliano lives in the city of Aguaytia. He is a very hardworking man, above all because he is the father of a family. His son is only one year old and he fills Imiliano with pride. It is for his son that Imiliano works as a farmer every day. Currently he has planted pineapple and he has been a farmer for about four years.

Imiliano is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to purchase compost and fertilizer and do maintenance on his crops. Consequently he will be able to have crops that develop under good conditions and yield a good harvest. Thus he  will continue working to make his great dream a reality, that of having his own plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizer and maintain his crops.

loans.name: Bir Hanuman Shg Group

texts.en: Bir Hanuman Self Help Group is located in a village in the Sonepur district of Odisha, India, and has 10 members. All members are women. As a group, they have supported and encouraged each other to save and improve their financial circumstances. Menaka is the president of the group and is standing with her hand raised in the photo. Menaka, 33 years old, lives with her husband and their one school-aged child in a humble home. Menaka’s husband works as a farmer in the village. To help supplement the income of her family, Menaka grows paddy in her field and sells it with the help of her husband. She has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and sacks for storing the paddy.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and sacks for storing the paddy.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Srey is 27 years old and married with one daughter. The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming. She has been in this business for several years. With the current business, she can earn about 33,000 KHR per day. 

This is the second loan for Srey with VisionFund. She successfully used the first loan to improve her livelihood. Now leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield and sell it for a good price in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Yarley Daniela

texts.es:
Yarley es una joven que desde que inicio el proceso escolar se ha destacado por el excelente desempeño académico, el promedio le permite ubicarse siempre en los primeros puestos.
En el proyecto de vida desde los 10 años ha tenido claro el querer desempeñarse en el área de la salud, por este motivo cuando campo alto  le brindo la oportunidad de poder adelantar estudios supo aprovechar la oportunidad he inicio el estudio como auxiliar de enfermería terminando el tercer semestre y al mismo tiempo culminando el bachillerato.
Es una joven que sabe aprovechar todas las ayudas que le brindan para permitirle cumplir los sueños, aparte la madre es quien responde por la educación y la de los tres hermanos; siendo madre soltera, le queda muy difícil asumir el costo total del semestre, es por eso que ella se ve interesada en el convenio que le ofrece kiva en este momento. 
Las aspiraciones son desempeñarse con todo el amor y vocación como auxiliar de enfermería, para así poder seguir pagando los estudios, ser un orgullo para la familia, brindarle un apoyo a ese ser que le dio la vida y el estudio, la madre. Todo esto contando siempre con la bendición de dios.
texts.en:
Yarley is a young woman who, since she began the schooling process, has been recognized for her excellent academic performance, her grade average has allowed her to always be placed at the top.

Since she was 10 years old, when thinking about her life´s projections, it has been clear to her that she wanted to work in the health field. For this reason, when Campo Alto offered her the opportunity to advance in her studies, she knew to take advantage of the opportunity and she began to study as a nursing assistant, finishing the third semester and at the same time concluding her high school degree.

She is a young woman who knows to take advantage of all the help she is offered, to allow her to fulfill her dreams. Plus, her mother is the one who has to pay for her education and that of her three siblings. Being a single mother, it is very difficult for her to assume the total cost of the semester, which is why she is interested in the help that Kiva is offering her at this moment.

Her aspirations are to study with all her love and passion to be a nursing assistant, so that she can continue paying for her studies, be a source of pride for the family, and offer help to the person who gave her the gift of life and studies: her mother. All of this supported always by the blessing of God.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of registration fees

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, and three of her children go to school. She takes care of one additional family member (mother). She has a business stall at the market on retail basis. She works for seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last five years. 

She requested a loan of Ugandan Shillings 400,000 (UGX) from MCDT – SACC0 to buy bunches of green bananas and bags of cassava and sweet  potatoes. Her major business challenges includes transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and to build rental houses. 

She lives in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Victoria’s major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas and bags of cassava and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en: Marhabo is a hardworking and smart woman. She is 52 years old. She is married and a careful mother of three children. All of them are adults. Marhabo’s husband is a migrant in Russia. He is a builder. Marhabo has been busy with animal husbandry. She feeds cows. She sells milk and milk products to the local market. Marhabo must repair the roof of her house as her house roof has broken. She is asking for a loan of 6,500 Somoni to buy slate to repair the roof. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy slate to repair her roof

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 33 years old and single. She lives in a rural community, cooking and selling meals and snacks within the school campus. She aims to make her business profitable in order to become financially stable. She wants to offer more kinds of recipes to her customers, but she has limited capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy macaroni, spaghetti, milk, sugar, cooking oil, pork, vegetables, and fish to be cooked and sold in the school campus. Having patience and strong determination, she believes that she will be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy macaroni, spaghetti, milk, sugar, cooking oil, pork, vegetables and fish.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel still runs his businesses of farming and baking. The businesses are doing very well thanks to the financial assistance he got from VisionFund Kenya and Kiva lenders. His monthly income has increased from KES 2,800 to KES 3,300. He uses the monthly income to support himself and his parents.

This marks his second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. He intends to use the loan to purchase more baking flour, oil and packaging bags.

Income will be directed to his farming business. In the future, he hopes to expand his businesses further and have his own family to look after.

loans.use: to purchase baking flour, oil and firewood for his baking business

loans.name: Sinoern's Group

texts.en:
Sinoern, 25, lives with her husband and two children in a village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for almost five years and they supplement the family’s income by working for others for a fee. They can earn about 50,000 KHR per day.

Sinoern has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for six loan cycles and completely paid back the loans. With the loans from VisionFund, she has managed to improve her livelihood. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. Sinoern wants to use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine rents a small store in one of the big markets of Gyumri town. She trades there with different types of household goods (toys, home supplies, etc.)

She is very kind and careful towards her clients and during these years of her work was able to gather a good client base. Karine has now applied for this loan of $3,000 to be able to purchase new supplies to sell in the store.

Karine will be very grateful if lenders help her with this loan and support her small business.

loans.use: to pay for supplies (toys, home supplies) to sell in the store

loans.name: Kapullichayoq Sj Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KAPULLICHAYOQ SJ” de la Asociación Arariwa y viven en el distrito de San Jeronimo de la provincia del Cusco, Perú. Irene tiene 44 años de edad,es viuda y tiene cinco hijos, ella se dedica al negocio de venta de comida y cerveza, ella tiene un pequeño restaurante en su domicilio. ya son 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Irene en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, verduras y carne. (Irene esta levantando la mano en la fotografía). 

Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de comida, venta de abarrotes, venta de chicha de Jora y otros brindan servicios transportes y picapedreros. Los socios agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “Kapullichayoq SJ” of the Arariwa Association and they live in the district of San Jeronimo in the province of Cusco, Peru. Irene is 44 years old. She is a widow and has five children. She works selling food and beer. She has a small restaurant in her home. She has been in this business for ten years and is doing very well. Irene at this time requires a loan to buy supplies such as bags of rice, vegetables and meat. (Irene is raising her hand in the photograph.)

Some members work selling food, groceries, and brewed beer, and others offer transport and stonecutting services. The members are grateful to those who are a part of this dream through this medium and they promise to make their loan payments according to the established plan.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as bags of rice, vegetables, and meat

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 47-year-old married mother of three children who has been working as a hairdresser and a makeup artist for the past ten years. Sabah works from her house because she isn't currently financially capable of establishing her own beauty salon. She prefers to keep her business at home or to provide her services at her customers' homes upon their requests so that she can provide the necessary care to her beloved children.

Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a special tattoo machine and special beauty products that will help her develop her business and attract more customers. This will also enable her to respond to almost all of her customers' needs. 

She hopes that through this loan she will increase her income. She also hopes to be able to establish her own beauty salon outside her house in the near future, which she will develop to cover almost all of women's beauty needs.

loans.use: To buy a special tattoo machine and special beauty products

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 28 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rosie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Rosie has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now is requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Maa Tarini Ssg Group

texts.en:
Maa Tarini Self Help Group is located in the village of Tikarapada in the Sonepur district in Odisha, India, and has 12 members. All members are women. As a group, they have supported and encouraged each other to save and improve their financial circumstances. Tilottama is the president of the group and is standing with her hand raised in the photo. Tilottama, 28, lives with her husband and their two school-aged children in a humble home. Tilottama’s husband works as a fisherman in Lakes. To help supplement the income for their family, Tilottama prepares and dries fish to sell in the village market. A loan from Kiva will help her purchase fishing net and a storage box to sell more fish and increase her profit.

She is very happy and grateful to Kiva for this kind help and support.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing net and a storage box

loans.name: Ferista

texts.en: Ferista lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with 4 children, 3 of whom go to school. She doesn’t  take care of any additional family members. She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in business for the last 4 years. She gets additional income from offering saloon services and selling  piped water. She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 400,000 from MCDT – SACC0 to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major challenge includes transportation and seasonality which hinders her movements. Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Ya's Group

texts.en:
Ya is 38 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a rural village of the Moung Russey district. Rice farming is the main source for her family’s income and she has been farming rice on a four-hectare area of farmland for about 20 years. The current business earns her family the daily income of about 50,000KHR but she is able to save 20,000KHR each day. 
This is the fourth loan for Ya with VisionFund and she completely paid back the previous loans. She is now leading her group to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Little Seeds Preparatory (C) Group

texts.en:
"There will be so many times you feel like you’ve failed, but in the eyes, heart and mind of your child, you are super mom,” shares Chaobi. Her undying love for the kids makes her work harder and be positive in life.  She works in a brick field and makes a living to feed her four sons.Since the death of her husband, Chaobi has been taking care of the family all by herself. Chaobi and her son are pictured with their hand raised and the group is called Little Seeds Preparatory (c) Group. The group is comprised of 14 mothers who are willing to work hard for their kid’s education.

Chaobi's two elder sons could not continue their higher studies and they are working as bus drivers for others. Chaobi again says how much she wishes to get them at least their own vehicle and let them make a living but that is not possible for a single mother who is a mere laborer. Her youngest son is still young and Chaobi is determined to give him a good educational background and groom him for success.
 
With the Kiva loan, she will pay for the school admission fees, textbooks and stationary and other annual expenses for the complete twelve months. She is happy and says she will repay the loan on time and would like to continue this partnership. It is a big opportunity for her and the family, says Chaobi.

loans.use: To pay for school admission fees, textbooks and stationary and other annual expenses

loans.name: Bahtiniso

texts.en: Bahtiniso was born in 1991. She is married and has a little daughter. She lives with her family in the North part of Tajikistan in a village. Her husband is a farmer. She wants to help her husband make a living. She is going to organize her own sewing business. Bahtiniso can to sew her national women’s clothes and Europe style clothes. She took part in a course ‘To get Ahead’ from a women's organization and got a lot of useful information for herself. She is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her new business

loans.name: Khairiya

texts.en:
Khairiya is a 56-year-old married mother of two children who has been working as a tailor since four years ago to make sure she can support her beloved husband in covering their increasing family needs and requests. Khairiya is a hard worker, well known in her region with her special talents and experience in her domain. She has a very good reputation among her customers and is recommended to many others.
Khairiya is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her personal medical expenses so she can stay in good health to keep on financially supporting her beloved family members. She hopes that after her medication, she'll stay capable of developing her business through adding more machines and expanding her working zone.

loans.use: to pay for her personal medical expenses so she can stay in good health to keep on financially supporting her beloved family members.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is a divorced young woman from Maralik village. She lives with her father, mother and daughter (in the photo).
Lilit's mother works at local clinic and is a sanitarian. Together with her farther, Lilit runs a farm. They are involved in cattle breeding and some limited land cultivation where they grow grass as forage for the livestock. 
Lilit now asks this loan of USD 2000 to be able to enlarge the livestock by 6 more oxen. Because of hard financial conditions, the family manages only to meet their basic need, which is why they aren't able to save money for the farm. 
The whole family will be very grateful to lenders for their support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for 6 oxen

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is requesting a loan to stock maize and dry cassava to sell. He lives in Hoima-Uganda, is aged 31, and charged with responsibility of taking care of four children. He earns additional income from farming and desires to educate all the children and become a leading produce seller in his area. Weather changes and inadequate capital hinder his business.

loans.use: to stock maize and dry cassava to sell.

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Neang is 59 years old and has six children in total. Neang and her husband are rice farmers. They have been in this business for 12 years, earning about 50,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Neang has been with VisionFund for five cycles and completely paid back her loans, which have helped her to improve her livelihood from cycle to cycle. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. Neang will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow healthy rice. She also hopes to grow more rice to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sulhiniso

texts.en: Sulhiniso is a young and hardworking woman. She is 25 years old. Sulhiniso is divorced and has no children. She lives with her parents. Sulhiniso organized her own sewing business deal six month ago because she needed to earn money. Her parents are poor people. Sulhiniso sews women’s national dresses for local people. She services her clients in her house. She is going to buy a new sewing machine because she started the business with old sewing machine. She hopes that in the future, she will attract more clients. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine for her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her new business

loans.name: Marie Michelle's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement a été mise en place le 26 Juillet 2012 à l’occasion de son inauguration. Il regroupe en son sein des femmes animées d’un réel désire de développer des activités génératrices de revenu. Elles vivent dans le même village et entretiennent  de bons rapports de voisinage. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Marie (assise à droite avec une main levée), l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. C’est une femme très dynamique, son activité tourne autour de la vente de produits agricoles et locaux tels que l’huile de palme, le pain de singe, la pâte d’arachide et autres en provenance de la cueillette.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle désire acheter de l’huile de palme pour une valeur de 100 000 F CFA, du pain de singe et de la pâte d’arachide pour 150 000 F CFA.

Avec les bénéfices, elle désire renforcer son épargne ainsi que l’appui à son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales.
texts.en:
This group was instated on July 26, 2012, its first day of activity. It gathers women driven by a real desire to develop revenue-generating businesses. They live in the same village and enjoy pleasant neighborly relationships. Their main activity is retail.

Mrs. Marie (sitting to the right with her hand raised) is the group’s star borrower. She is very energetic, and her business centers on the sale of local agricultural products such as palm oil, baobab fruit, groundnut butter, and picked products.

With her new loan, she wants to purchase palm oil for an amount of 100,000 XOF, and baobab fruit and groundnut butter for 150,000 XOF.

With the profits, she means to increase her savings and to support her husband in dealing with the family’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy palm oil for 100,000 XOF as well as baobab fruit and groundnut butter for 150,000 XOF.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to make uniforms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies that support the cultivation of beans, celery and coffee

loans.name: Dienabou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement a été mise en place le 26 Juillet 2012 à l’occasion de son inauguration. Il regroupe en son sein des femmes animées d’un réel désire de développer des activités génératrices de revenu. Elles vivent dans le même village et entretiennent  de bons rapports de voisinage. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Diénabou (assise dans la deuxième rangée avec la main une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 40, est mariée et mère de 08 enfants dont une fille et 07 garçons. Son activité s’inscrit dans la vente de riz ordinaire dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 06 sacs de riz à 10 000 F CFA l’unité pour la revente par détail au prix de 300 F CFA le Kilo.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte consolider son épargne d’une part et d’autre part assurer une meilleure prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
This group was instated on July 26, 2012, its first day of activity. It gathers women driven by a real desire to develop revenue-generating businesses. They live in the same village and enjoy pleasant neighborly relationships. Their main activity is retail.

Mrs. Diénabou (sitting in the second row with her hand raised) is the group’s star borrower. She is 40 years old, married, and a mother of eight, one girl and seven boys. Her business centers on the sale of rice in local weekly markets.

With her new loan, she wants to purchase six bags of rice at 10,000 XOF each, to retail them at a price of 300 XOF per kilo.

With the profits, she means to increase her savings on the one hand, and to better provide  for her family’s needs on the other.

loans.use: to buy six bags of rice to retail.

loans.name: Fanta's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement a été mise en place le 26 Juillet 2012 à l’occasion de son inauguration. Il regroupe en son sein des femmes animées d’un réel désire de développer des activités génératrices de revenu. Elles vivent dans le même village et entretiennent  de bons rapports de voisinage. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fanta (assise dans la deuxième rangée avec la main une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 39 ans est mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont 02 garçons et une fille. Elle achète des produits de consommation qu’elle revend à l’état. Pour ce prêt elle va acheter de l’huile, du sucre, du savon et divers bouillons pour la revente au détail. 

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter au moins deux sacs sucre, un parquet de 32 morceaux de savon.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’assurer une meilleure prise en charge des besoins familiaux (habillement, santé, scolarité, nourriture).
texts.en:
This group was instated on July 26, 2012, its first day of activity. It gathers women driven by a real desire to develop revenue-generating businesses. They live in the same village and enjoy pleasant neighborly relationships. Their main activity is retail.

Mrs. Fanta (sitting in the second row with her hand raised) is the group’s star borrower. She is 39 years old, married, and a mother of three, two boys and one girl. She purchases consumer products which she retails as is. For this loan, she will purchase oil, sugar, soap, and a variety of bouillon cubes to retail.

Her new loan will allow her to purchase at least two bags of sugar and a box with 32 individual soaps.

Profits will make it possible for her to better provide for her family’s needs (clothing, healthcare, schooling, food).

loans.use: to buy at least two bags of sugar and a box with 32 individual soaps.

loans.name: Wastara Group

texts.en:
Edson, who is in his mid 40s, is married and has four children who are in school. Since 2005, Edson has been managing a business selling second-hand clothes, commonly known as mtumba in Swahili. Before, he was selling on top of a table, but with his previous loans he has made progress. He rented a shop where he is now able to increase sales and attract more customers. His business is open from 6am to 7pm daily, and he is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is Edson's eighth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans, all of which he successfully repaid, to rent a shop and restock clothes. Edson earned a profit, which he used to build a house and to buy a home fridge, sofa set, and TV. As a father, Edson paid for school fees and home food expenses. He really appreciates your support. He will use this loan to open a food shop, where he will sell dry food like rice, maize flour, baking flour, cooking oil, beans and related items. He dreams that one day he will be able to build another nice house. 

Edson will share this loan with his loan group Wastara, which totals 13 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open a food shop.

loans.name: Prosperidad Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PROSPERIDAD” de la Asociación Arariwa y viven en la ciudad del Cusco de la provincia del Cusco, Perú. 

Anabel tiene 32 años de edad,es casada y tiene un hijo, ella se dedica al negocio de venta de cosméticos por catalogo a crédito, ella ofrece a sus amigos, vecinos, familiares y compañeros de trabajo sus productos y le va muy bien. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mas cosméticos como por ejemplo aretes, perfumes y otras cosas.

Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de comida, venta de pinturas, venta de café y cacao, venta de abarrotes, elaboración de artesanía y otros brindan servicios turísticos y profesionales. Los socios agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.(Los socios que aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografía llegaron al día siguiente de la  reunión).
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Prosperity" of the Arariwa Association. They live in the city of Cusco and the Province of Cusco, Peru.

Anabel is 32 years old. She is married and has a son. She is in the sale of cosmetics by catalog for a living. She offers her products to her friends, neighbors, family and coworkers and it is going very well. She already has some years experience in this business and this time requires a loan to buy more cosmetics like earrings, perfumes, etc.

The other members are in the sale of food, paintings, coffee and cacao, groceries, and creating art for a living. Some provide touristic and professional services. The members are grateful to those who are part of this dream through this medium, and promise to comply with the payment schedule in the terms established. (The members that appear in the lower part of the photograph came the day after the meeting).

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics such as earrings, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Mastura

texts.en:
Mastura is an industrious woman from a rural area; she is 55 years old, and a careful mother of four children. Her husband is a master of repairing houses. 

11 years ago, Mastura began her own business deal selling children’s clothes. She sells children’s clothes in a local market where she has a selling place. Every season she renews the assortment of her goods; in this way she attracts customers. 

Mastura is going to buy goods for the new spring season. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 Somoni to buy children’s clothes for the new season. 

She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy children’s clothes for the new season

loans.name: Asmao's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement a été mise en place le 03 Juillet 2002 à l’occasion de son inauguration. Il est composé de femmes animées d’une volonté manifeste d’améliorer leurs conditions d’existence. Elles vivent toutes dans la même localité et ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Asmao (assise à droite la main une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 49 ans, mariée et mère de 10 enfants dont 07 garçons et 03 filles. C’est une femme qui jouit d’une bonne expérience dans le commerce, elle vend divers produits en passant de l’arachide au encens.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter des sacs d’arachides décortiqués pour 240 000 F CFA soit environ 80 sacs et le reste pour de l’encens à hauteur de 50 000 F CFA.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d'assurer une meilleure condition de vie à famille de même que les frais scolaires.
texts.en:
This group was instated on July 3, 2002, its first day of activity. It gathers women driven by an obvious desire to improve their living conditions. They all live in the same village and their main activity is retail.

Mrs. Asmao (sitting to the right with her hand raised) is the group’s star borrower. She is 49 years old, married, and a mother of ten, seven boys and three girls. She has valuable experience in trade; she retails various products from groundnuts to incense. 

With her new loan she plans to purchase bags of shelled groundnuts for 240,000 XOF (i.e. about 80 bags), with the remained going to incense, up to 50,000 XOF.

Profits will make it possible for her to improve her family’s living conditions and to pay school expenses.

loans.use: to buy about 8 bags of shelled groundnuts and incense.

loans.name: Floride

texts.en: Floride is 46 years old. She is married with seven children and they all go to school. Floride sells foodstuffs such as rice and sugar; she has been in the business for the past ten years.  She has requested the loan to buy more rice to add more sales in her stall. With the profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is age 43 and lives in Hoima, Uganda.  He deals in produce, and he earns an additional income from a bar, a school and rentals.  He has five children.  

His business faces a problem of debtors and delayed rental payments.

He is acquiring a loan to buy more maize and beans for selling, targeting this peak season where he expects to reap huge profits.

Frank desires to buy a personal car.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans for selling.

loans.name: Chanthorn's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Chanthorn is aged 27 years old and married. She has one child who is too young for school. To feed her family she has worked hard as a rice farmer for five years and she also works as a garment worker. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day. 
Chanthorn has completed one loan cycle with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farm. She hopes to make healthy rice to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farm

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila was born in 1979. She is married and has 4 children. She and her husband have been busy with agriculture. Jamila feeds sheep. She sells sheep in a local market. She has an additional income from growing crops and potatoes. She has been busy with this business more than 10 years. Jamila wants to further develop her business as the only source of family income is from agricultural activity. She is asking for a loan of 2000 USD to buy sheep, seeds and mineral fertilizer. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy sheep, seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Sheila Mercedes

texts.es:
Sheila, tiene 24 años actualmente se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Agrónoma en la Universidad San Pedro, su carrera consta de 5 años y se encuentra en el penúltimo año. 

Ella hace sus prácticas pre-profesionales en la misma universidad, dedica 30 horas semanales para sus estudios y se siente muy satisfecha y a la vez entusiasmada de poder estar logrando uno de sus más deseados sueños de convertirse en una profesional.

Su anhelo más grande es poder terminar su carrera satisfactoriamente por eso que le pone muchas ganas para así superar cualquier obstáculo que se le presente, el préstamo solicitado será utilizado para el pago completo del octavo y noveno ciclo de su carrera y algunos materiales educativos y así ella pueda sentirse más tranquila.

Su meta a un futuro es poder culminar sus estudios y comenzar a trabajar y ayudar a los agricultores; anhela exportar a diferentes países ya teniendo su propio negocio.

A la vez nos da su aporte de agradecimiento ya que se siente agradecida por el préstamo que se le brindó y anima que sigan apoyando a las personas que más lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Sheila is 24 years old. She is now studying agronomic engineering at the University of San Pedro. Her course of study takes five years, and she is in the next-to-last year.

She is doing her pre-professional practice at the same university. She spends 30 hours a week on her studies, and she feels very satisfied and at the same time enthusiastic from being able to be successful. One of her most desired dreams is to become a professional.

Her greatest wish is to be able to finish her studies satisfactorily. For this reason she has a great will to overcome any obstacle that is presented to her. The loan that she is applying for will be used to completely pay for the eighth and ninth semesters of her course and for any educational materials, and thus she can feel more at ease.

Her goal for the future is to be able to finish her studies and begin to work and to help farmers. She aspires to export to other countries once she has her own business.

At the same time she expresses her appreciation since she feels grateful for the loan that is offered to her, and she encourages [the lenders] to continue supporting the people who most need it.

loans.use: to buy educational materials

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children; four of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (cousins). 

Victoria sells second-hand clothes at the market on retail basis. She works seven days a week, and she has been in business for the last two years. She gets additional income from offering saloon services piped water. 

She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 500,000 from MCDT -SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand clothes. 

Her major business challenges include transportattion and thieves.  

Her goal and aspirations are to becoming a wholesaler, and also to build rental houses. 

Victoria lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. 

Her major expenses include food, power and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Kadiatou Mouskeba's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 14 janvier 1998, le banc villageois est composé de femmes très engagées dans le développement d’activités génératrices e revenus. Tous membres du groupement du vivent dans le même quartier et entretiennent des relations séculaires  de bon voisinage. De plus elles ont en majorité une grande expérience du système des bancs villageois.

Madame Kadidiatou (assise à droite avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Elle est célibataire et mère de 02 filles dont la charge repose exclusivement et sa mère. Elle s’active dans la vente de tissus teintés et d’huile de palme qu’elle achète dans la sous région pour la revente à la capitale et dans les régions du centre par crédit de deux mensualités.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter au moins 10 bidons d’huile de palme de 20 litres et le reste pour divers tissus.

 Elle compte, avec les bénéfices apportés une meilleure prise en charge scolaire de ses deux filles.
texts.en:
Created on January 14, 1998, this village group gathers women who are very invested in developing revenue-generating activities. All members of the group live in the same neighborhood, and enjoy pleasant secular relations. In addition, the vast majority of them have some experience with the local micro-financing system.

Mrs. Kadidiatou (sitting to the right with her hand raised) is the group’s star borrower. She is single and a mother of two girls, whose care she provides for by herself. She is in the business of dyed fabrics and palm oil, which she purchases locally and resells at the capital and in the center region; she grants 2-month payment terms to her clients.

With her new loan she plans to purchase at least ten 20-kilo containers of palm-oil, with the loan's remainder going to a variety of fabrics.

Profits will allow her to improve her daughters’ schooling.

loans.use: to buy at least ten twenty-kilo containers of palm oil and an assortment of fabrics.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian  is married with two children and lives with her family, where she has a farm. In addition to farming she has had a general store that sells assorted grocery goods in their village. She earns better income from this. Recently she took a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the farm and additional grocery goods to sell. In the future she wants her farm to be a greener pasture and hopes to improve the business in order to have a better living.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the farm and additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Samun's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Ssamun is a 40-year-old mother of two dependent children. To support her children Samun has been farming rice for 20 years and she also sells grocery items to earn more income. Together, they can earn her about KHR 40,000 per day and she can save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs.
This is Samun’s first microloan with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. Samun will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farm. Samun hopes to grow her rice on time so as to better her family’s living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farm

loans.name: Astera

texts.en:
Astera is 60 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Astera has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years, and also earns an income from pig fattening and videoke rentals.

Astera aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Basilisa works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns an additional income from frozen foods.  

Basilisa is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of items like shirts, blouses, bags and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Basilisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of items like shirts, blouses, bags and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Nargisi

texts.ru: Наргиси 39-летняя разведенная женщина, воспитывающая двоих детей. Ее сыновьям по 5 и 7 лет, старший сын уже ходит в школу. Наргиси живет с детьми у брата в городе Куляб. Она, чтобы обеспечивать себя и детей занимается торговлей. У нее на местном рынке имеется торговая точка, где Наргиси продает детские одежды. Она хорошо разбирается в своем бизнесе, так как занимается этим уже 8 лет. Чтобы увеличить товарооборот Наргиси необходимо привезти новый сезонный товар. С такой целью она обратилась за кредитом. Наргиси хочет закупить коллекцию сезонной детской одежды для продажи. Она очень надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Nargisi is a 39-year-old divorced woman who is raising two children. Her sons are 5 and 7 years old. Her older son already attends school. Nargisi lives with her children and brother in the city of Kulob. In order to provide for herself and her children, she is in the business of retail sales. Nargisi has a shop at the local market where she sells children's clothing. She deals well with her business as she has been doing it for 8 years already.  In order to increase her sales turnover, Nargisi must bring in new, seasonal merchandise. She requested a loan for that purpose. Nargisi wants to buy a collection of seasonal children's clothing to sell. She really relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy seasonal children's clothing for retail sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, coffee forumla, and to pay laborers to care for the coffee crops

loans.name: Bayardo Nicolas

texts.es: Don Bayardo es originario de la ciudad de Estelí, casado y padre de seis hijos, cinco de ellos ya independientes. Tiene 53 años de edad. Se dedica a la reparación de Maquinas de sastrería. Inicio su negocio trabajando en talleres, en donde adquirió conocimientos y luego los utilizo para poner su propio negocio. Su meta próxima es entregar los trabajos asignados por sus clientes a tiempo. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Bobines, Motores entre otros repuestos. Estima que el crédito le ayudara a brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Su plan futuro es establecer un negocio más amplio.
texts.en: Don Bayardo is a native of the city of Estelí. He is married and is the father of six children, five of whom are already independent. He is 53 years old. He repairs sewing machines. He began his business working in workshops, where he acquired his knowledge, and then he used it to set up his own business. His next goal is to deliver the work assigned by his customers on time. He is applying for the loan to buy coils and motors, among other spare parts. He feels that the loan will help him offer better service to his customers. His plan for the future is to establish a more extensive business.

loans.use: to buy coils, motors, and other spare parts

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 26-year-old married father of one child, who has been selling birds for 10 years. In 2008, Ali established his current business, and he is very happy with the step he took which will improve and develop his family's socioeconomic situation.

Ali is a hard worker who puts in much effort to run his business to make sure that it is enough to cover his family's living needs. His father taught him the business since his father is an expert in this domain and he gave the love of this business to his child too. 

Today, Ali is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to buy the necessary food and supplies to develop his business and provide his beloved birds with their living needs. Ali is very anxious to have this loan, and he is looking forward to developing his business to make sure that it brings in a very good income. He wants to make sure he can cover his family's increasing needs.

loans.use: To buy the necessary food and supplies for raising his beloved birds and developing his business

loans.name: Aissatou Same's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 14 janvier 1998, le banc villageois est composé de femmes très engagées dans le développement d’activités génératrices e revenus. Tous membres du groupement du vivent dans le même quartier et entretiennent des relations séculaires  de bon voisinage. De plus elles ont en majorité une grande expérience du système des bancs villageois.

Madame Aissatou (Assise  à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 51 ans et mère de 05 enfants dont 02 garçons et 03 filles. Elle vendeuse de jus naturel à base de produits locaux tels que le bissap, le gingembre, le pain de singe, elle fait aussi de la glace qu’elle vend dans son quartier.  Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter un sac de sucre de 50 kg, un sac de feuille de bissap, du pain de singe et divers produits entrant dans la fabrication de ses jus.

Les bénéfices que génère l’activité lui permettront de mieux accompagner son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Created on January 14, 1998, the Banc Villageois is made up of women who are very involved in the development of income-generating activities.  All the members of the group live in the same part of town and have always entertained good neighborly relations.  Most of these women also have a good experience of the Banc Villageois system.

Aissatou is the group's featured borrower.  In the photo, she is the woman seated at the far right and raising her hand.  She is married, 51 years old and the mother of five children (two boys and three girls).  She sells natural juices made with local products such as hibiscus leaves, ginger and baobab fruits.  She also makes ice-cream, which she sells in her neighborhood, and she has a good experience in that field of work. 

She plans to use her new loan to buy a 50-kilo bag of sugar, a bag of hibiscus leaves, some baobab fruits as well as various other products to make juices.  With the profits from her business, she will be able to better help her husband with the management of the day-to-day needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy a 50-kilo bag of sugar, a bag of hibiscus leaves, some baobab fruits and various other products to make juices.

loans.name: Guliza

texts.ru: Гулизе 28 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Гулизы - среднее образование, вместе с мужем Гулиза занимается животноводством и полеводством, а также на территории дома имеется большой яблоневый сад, стартовав 8 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулизы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 40 овец, 20 ягнят. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS) от реализации молока, от продажи яблок, также обрабатывает 5,0 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -фасоль и многолетние травы. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулиза обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулиза планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Guliza is 28 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising two children. Guliza has a secondary education. Guliza and her husband practice livestock breeding and crop farming. They also have a large apple orchard on the territory of their home. They started this business 8 years ago with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Guliza's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows, 40 sheep and 20 lambs on her farm. Her monthly income is 20,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk and apples. She also cultivates a 5.0 hectare plot of land on which she primarily grows beans and perennial grasses. The received harvest is sold to wholesale distributors. For the purpose of further developing her business, Guliza turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy sheep to increase the size of her herd. Guliza plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to make house repairs.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 3 heifer calves

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.ru: Чолпон 42 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Чолпон - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Чолпон занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 12 лет назад, с 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Чолпон, на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 10 овец, также арендует 1,0 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает арбузы, кукурузу, огурцы, хлопок для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации, на участке дома расположена теплица. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чолпон обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом для закупа высококачественных семян арбузов, огурцов и хлопка, для посевных работ и удобрений для обработки земли. Чолпон намерена получить хороший урожай, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Чолпон планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство еще одной теплицы
texts.en: Cholpon is 42 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising three children. Cholpon has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Cholpon practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 12 years ago with 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Cholpon's hard work, she currently has 1 milk cow and 10 sheep on her farm, as well as a 1.0 hectare plot of land on which she annually grows watermelons, corn cucumbers and cotton for personal consumption and sale. On the lot of their home, they also have a greenhouse. Their monthly cumulative income is 15,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Cholpon turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy high quality watermelon, cucumber, and cotton seeds for sowing as well as fertilizers for cultivating the land. Cholpon is determined to receive a good harvest which will fundamentally increase her family's capital. Cholpon plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to build one more greenhouse.

loans.use: to buy watermelon, cucumber, and cotton seeds as well as fertilizers.

loans.name: Marofat

texts.en:
Marofat is a kind woman and was born in 1968. She is married and has three children. 

She is a repeat client of CSC MDO "IMON International" and has a good credit history. Her previous loan was used for developing her business. 

Marofat has been busy with animal husbandry and feeding cows for more than four years. She buys cattle, feeds them for some months, and sells them at the local market. She earns additional income from growing crops. 

She is going to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 TJS to buy cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith lives in Misamis Occidental with her three children. 

She runs a general store selling goods in the local community to earn a living and started the store five years ago. Her husband earns from transportation services in their village when he's done fishing. 

Judith borrowed a loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC)  to purchase additional grocery goods to sell in order to increase sales. She plans to expand her store in order to gain more income for the family needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Aibek

texts.ru: Айбек 22 года, холост, проживает с родителями. У Айбека - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айбек занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 4 года назад, с 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айбека, на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 10 овец, имеется парник на территории дома, также имеется 1,30 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает арбуз, хлопок и кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айбек обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом для закупа высококачественных семян кукурузы, арбузов, хлопка для посевных работ и удобрений для обработки земли. Айбек намерен получить хороший урожай, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Айбек планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку автомашины.
texts.en: Aibek is 22 years old, single, and lives with his parents. Aibek has a secondary education. As the main source of income for his family, Aibek practices livestock breeding and crop farming. He started this business 4 years ago with 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Aibek's hard work, he currently has 2 milk cows and 10 sheep on his farm. He also has a greenhouse on the lot of his house. He additionally has a 1.30 hectare plot of land on which he annually grows watermelons, cotton, and corn for personal consumption and sale. His monthly cumulative income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing his business, Aibek turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." He is requesting a loan to buy high quality corn, watermelon, and corn seeds for sowing as well as fertilizers for cultivating the land. Aibek is determined to receive a good harvest which will fundamentally increase his family's capital. Aibek plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. He also intends to save money to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy corn, melon and cotton seeds as well as fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy retail stock, including wood, paint and nails, for her hardware store.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma has been helping her husband with working on their own farm to make a living. For many years, she earned well to sustain their living. With her generated income, she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the farm. 

She borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) recently to buy organic fertilizer. She wants to improve farm production and to use the income for her children's education. 

In the future, Erma hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette is 25 years old. She is a mother of three children aged between 2 weeks old and 6 years old.   

Antoinette sells different retail items in her shop. She has requested the loan to buy more cooking oil, lotions. and soaps for sale. 

She plans to use the profits for providing foods for the family.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, lotions, and soaps for sale

loans.name: Mairash

texts.ru: Майраш 45 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Майраш - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Майраш занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Майраш, на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 10 овец, парник расположен на территории дома, также имеется 1,80 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает кукурузу, арбузы, хлопок для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Майраш обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом для закупа высококачественных семян кукурузы, арбузов, хлопка для посевных работ и удобрений для обработки земли. Майраш намерена получить хороший урожай, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Майраш планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового помещения для скота.
texts.en: Mairash is 45 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising five children. Mairash has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Mairash practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 14 years ago with 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Mairash's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows and 10 sheep on her farm. She also has a greenhouse on the territory of her house. She additionally has a 1.80 hectare plot of land on which she annually grows corn, watermelons and cotton for personal consumption and sale. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Mairash turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy high quality corn, watermelon and cotton seeds for sowing as well as fertilizers for cultivating the land. Mairash is determined to receive a good harvest, which will fundamentally increase her family's capital. Mairash plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to buy a new barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy corn, melon, and cotton seeds as well as fertilizers.

loans.name: Nato

texts.en:
Nato is a 45-year-old married woman from the village of Maghlaki in the Tskhaltubo district. She lives with her daughter and parents-in-law. The family lives under poverty and gets social assistance of 100 GEL. 

Agricultural activity is a significant source of income for family. Nato is engaged in breeding dairy cows, producing milk products, and cultivating a plot of agricultural land where greens are grown. She sells milk products and greens locally and generates some income. 

For further development, her business needs some investment. Nato requested money for building a greenhouse in which to cultivate their vegetables and greens. She will expand her assortment of harvested products and will generate more income. 

Nato will be grateful for the help Kiva lenders can provide as she can get a chance to better the living condition of her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.es:
Marilyn a sus 44 años de edad, es una mujer pujante y trabajadora, que lucha incansablemente para conseguir ingresos que le permitan apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y la educación universitaria de su único hijo.
Desde hace 8 años trabaja como comerciante independiente, vendiendo mercancía como ropa y calzado, sus principales clientes son familiares, amigos y conocidos del sector donde reside.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de surtido al por mayor (jeans, camisetas, tenis, blusas, chaquetas), así tendrá más variedad para ofrecer y satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, mejorando las ventas y por ende los ingresos que percibe con su labor.
Marilyn manifiesta que su mayor propósito es seguir velando por el bienestar de su familia, por ello quiere seguir trabajando con esfuerzo y dedicación para acreditar bien su negocio y garantizar una estabilidad económica que le permita disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de los que ama.
texts.en:
Marilyn is 44 years old and a hardworking woman who strives tirelessly to earn an income so she can help her husband with the household finances and her only son’s university education.  

She has worked as an independent merchant for the past eight years, selling merchandise such as clothing and shoes.  Her main customers are her family, friends, and acquaintances in the area.  She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise (jeans, t-shirts, sneakers, blouses, and jackets).  This way she will have a variety of merchandise to satisfy her customer wants and needs, improving her sales and income through her labor.

Marilyn says that her main purpose is to continue working for her family’s wellbeing and she wants to continue working with effort and dedication to accredit her business well and guarantee her family’s financial stability so she can enjoy a better quality of life with her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store, so that she can continue to pay for her son’s university education.

loans.name: Triphine

texts.en:
Triphine is 40 years old. She is a mother of five. 

She sells shoes and has been in the business for the past 15 years. She has requested a loan to upgrade her shoe business by adding more types and varieties of shoe styles to meet the needs of her customers. 

The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house that she is currently living in.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.ru: Гульзар 30 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Гульзар - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гульзар занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гульзар, на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 10 овец, парник расположен на территории дома, также имеется 1,5 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает арбуз, хлопок, кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульзар обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом для закупа высококачественных семян арбузов, хлопка, кукурузы для посевных работ и удобрений для обработки земли. Гульзар намерена получить хороший урожай, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Гульзар планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Gulzar is 30 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising five children. Gulzar has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Gulzar practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 10 years ago with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulzar's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows and 10 sheep on her farm. She also has a greenhouse on the territory of her home. She additionally has a 1.5 hectare plot of land on which she annually grows watermelons, cotton, and corn for personal consumption and sale. Her monthly cumulative income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Gulzar turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy high quality watermelon, cotton, and corn seeds for sowing as well as fertilizers for cultivating the land. Gulzar is determined to receive a good harvest which will fundamentally increase her family's capital. Gulzar plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy corn, melon and cotton seeds as well as fertilizers.

loans.name: Henrietta

texts.en:
Henrietta helps her husband operate their own farm. She plants and harvests rice to sell in the local community to earn a living. With her generated revenue, she was able to expand and to improve the farm. Her farm's production increased, and it helped her a lot. 

Her previous loan used for the farm was successfully repaid. Henrietta was determined to make enough money from farming. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase seedlings, fertilizer, and organic pesticides. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the farm to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizer, and organic pesticides.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is an entrepreneural person who is married and has two children.

She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than five years. Little by little and with the passing of the time, she has perfected her knowledge. 

Thanks to the animals' good condition, she has managed to win a large quantity of customers for her business. She sells her animals at the local market and has many customers. Many of her customers are local butchers who are glad with her work. 

Nargis is looking for a loan to buy young cattle for increasing working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy young cattle for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Marion

texts.en:
Marion lives in Hoima, Uganda and is 22 years old. 

She sells electronics and earns additional income from a bar. Marion started business in 2012 after having gotten a little savings from farming.

She desires to expand her business to new markets. She is challenged by competition and price fluctuations that hinder her business. 

Marion needs the loan to buy more electronics to sell.

loans.use: to buy more electronics to sell.

loans.name: Ruteete Twimuke Group

texts.en: Teddy is a hardworking lady from Fort Portal, Uganda and a member of the Ruteete Twimukye Group.  She is 55 and  married with five children.  She operates a retail shop in her area that helps her support her family and she supplements with farming. She started the business 33 years ago to support her family and now requests a loan to boost her business despite the many competitors that pose a great challenge. Teddy is determined to work harder to expand her house.  In groups, members guarantee one another to get a loan instead of giving security.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a married woman and a mother of seven grown-up children. She lives in the town of Albur, Bohol. She has been in the sari-sari (variety) store business for several years now. This is the source of her income.

Wilma is asking for a loan to purchase additional merchandise like canned goods, soap, toiletries, coffee and sugar. With this, she will be able to improve the variety of her stock, thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Wilma hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise like canned goods, soap, toiletries, coffee and sugar

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en: Pelagie is 30-years-old. She is married with two children, who are between the ages of five and nine.  They all go to school.  She has spent nine years in the business of selling retail items. With the loan, she would like to buy more soap and sugar to sale. The profits from the business will be used to earn savings.

loans.use: To buy more soap and sugar to sale.

loans.name: Ivone Gabriela

texts.es: Ivone tienen 21 años de edad es madre soltera tienen una hija de 2 años y un hijo de 2 meses. Ella vive con sus hijos, su madre y una hermana de 15 años que se encuentra asistiendo al colegio, Ivone es un mujer que lucha por sus hijos, comenta que se dedica desde hace 2 años a cuidar vacas para ordeñarlas y vender la leche y así obtener los ingresos necesarios para la salud y alimentación suya y de sus hijos. Con el crédito va a comprar una vaca para seguir con su actividad de la ganadería. Esta joven aspira  que su negocio siga creciendo para tener el dinero suficiente para comprar un terreno donde pueda tener sus vacas y así sus ingresos sean más altos y de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de  sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ivone is 21 years old and a single mother with one 2-year-old daughter and a 2-month-old son. She lives with her children, her mother, and a 15-year-old sister who's in school. Ivone is a woman who fights for her children. She tells us that for two years now she's been keeping dairy cows so she can sell the milk and make the money she needs to provide for her health and nutrition, as well as for that of her children. 

With this loan, she will buy a cow so she can continue in her work as a dairy farmer. She is young and aspires for her business to keep on growing so she can make enough money to buy her own property where she can keep her cows and, thus, increase her income. This way she'll be able to improve her children's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Saroeurng

texts.en:
Saroeurng is 39 years old and a married mother of four children. Saroeurng operates a farming business which is located in Bakan district, Pursat province, Cambodia. She has been farming as her major source of income for nearly 15 years. She has her own land where she primarily grows rice and sells to the local markets. Her business is going well.

Saroeurng is now asking for a loan which she will use to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members and to improve her household sanitation practices. Thanks to the water loan program with its special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Saroeurng is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguarding the health of her family and protecting the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members

loans.name: Dorah

texts.es: Dorah es madres soltera de un hijo, vive en la casa de sus padres en una casa de ladrillo y machimbre que cuenta con luz, agua y alcantarillado. Dorah es comerciante de accesorios para mujeres, ella empuja un carrito durante todo el dia, lo cual la deja muy cansada puesto que tiene que estar parada durante toda la jornada. Dorah se enfrenta a los peligros de las calles y del clima, pues no tiene una sombrilla en su carrito. Dorah solicita un prestamo para comprar vinchas para cabello, ligas de colores y otros articulos para cabello de mujer que ella quiere vender en mayor cantidad. Dorah es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por eso el credito es urgente para ella.
texts.en:
Dorah is a single mother with one son. She lives with her parents in a brick and board house that has electricity, running water, and plumbing. Dorah is a saleswoman of women's accessories and she pushes a cart around all day. This leaves her very tired, as she has to remain on her feet all day long.  Dorah endures the hazards of the streets and the weather, as she doesn't have an umbrella on her cart. 

Dorah is taking out this loan to buy hair bands, string in a variety of colors, and other women's accessories that she would like to sell in higher quantity. Dorah is the only source of income for her household, so this loan is very important to her.

loans.use: to buy hair bands, string in a variety of colors, and other hair accessories for women.

loans.name: Munirakhon

texts.ru: Мунирахон продавщица из города Турсунзаде. Ей 41 год. Она заботливая жена и мать двоих детей. Мунирахон деятельная и работящая женщина. Она в течение 3 лет занимается куплей и продажей тканей и материалов. Мунирахон трудится усердно, чтобы вкладывать в бюджет семьи. Она помогает мужу в обеспечении семьи. Сейчас Мунирахон просит кредит для развития торговли. Она собирается закупить разнообразный ассортимент сезонных тканей. С приходом весны женщины будут приобретать больше тканей для шитья платьев. В связи с этим Мунирахон хочет увеличить ассортимент предлагаемых тканей для привлечения большего количества клиенток. Она надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Munirakhon is a salesperson from Tursun-zoda city. She is 41 years old. She is an attentive wife and mother of two children. Munirakhon is an active and hardworking woman. She has been buying and selling fabric and materials for three years. She works very hard to add to her family's budget. She helps her husband provide for their family. Now Munirakhon is requesting a loan to develop her retail business. She is planning to buy a wide range of seasonal fabrics. With the arrival of spring, women will purchase more fabric for sewing dresses. In connection with this, Munirakhon wants to increase her assortment of offered fabrics to attract a larger number of customers. She relies on your financial support.

loans.use: to buy and resell fabric and materials.

loans.name: Tải

texts.en:
Mrs. Tải works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
Tải is 53 years old and married with two children She lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Tải joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tải has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Tải faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to repair her latrine/toilet. 

With her business profit, Tải hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to  repair her latrine/toilet .

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita lives in Ani Kayaran village with her husband and daughter. Her husband works at a local private company.

Rita herself has been running a farm. It is small and includes only 4 cows and 2 calves. Rita uses the milk in cheese production and sells it in nearby open markets. Income from agriculture is very important for Rita's family and she would greatly like to expand it. Rita owns a plot of land, but because of difficult financial conditions she isn't able to start the cultivation process. Therefore, she asks for this loan of USD 1,000 to be able to purchase seeds, fertilizer and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan will be a huge support for Rita's farming business and she hopes for lenders' support.

As this is Rita's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who do not have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure in order to care for her coffee crops

loans.name: Manzurakhon

texts.en: Manzurakhon was born in 1977. She is divorced and has a son who is 17 years old. Seven years ago, Manzurakhon organized her own bakery business.
