She cooks flatbread and sells it in a local market. She tries to cook tasty flatbreads in this way to attract more clients. She is the only breadwinner for her son. She is asking for a loan of 11,000 Somoni to buy flour to make more flatbread. From the profit, she is going to improve her living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy flour to make more flatbread

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, a 59-year-old widowed mother of one, lives in Thika.  She earns her living by operating a private medical clinic. She has been operating the clinic for the past five years and earns a monthly income of KES 8,000, which she uses to support herself and her daughter. 

She is requesting her fifth loan from VisionFund Kenya in order to purchase more drugs to sale. With the additional income, she will reinvest in the business and repay her loan. She hopes to expand her clinic into a hospital and improve her family’s living standards. 

She hopes to have a financially stable life.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en: Rafael, 42 and a father of three, operates a transportation service in the community while his wife earns from vending food in their village. He also works as a glass installer on request and he earns more income from this activity. He has joined GDMPC recently and borrowed a new loan to buy tires. He has to provide good services to his customers for it is his way of earning an income. In the future, he wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is 31-years-old living in Hoima, Uganda.  She deals in producing mainly maize, groundnuts and beans.  She has two children and both attend school. She earns additional income from a hotel business. As a loving mother, Harriet dreams of taking care of her two children by providing them with all their basic needs, especially education.  However, she faces the problems of competition, price fluctuations and inadequate capital.  Thus, she opted for a loan to to buy more maize and beans for selling.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: rice, beans, detergents, sweets, etc. for the expansion and improvement of her business.

loans.name: Oltin

texts.ru: Олтин жительница района Шахритус. Ей 48 лет. Олтин замужем. У нее есть 19 летний сын. Олтин в течение многих лет занимается древним ремеслом. Она гравирует стенки сундука, обшивая разными цветами и рисунками. Олтин получила такое ремесло от своих родителей наследством. Данное умение передается от поколения к поколению. Олтин приняла ремесло и по сей день продолжает заниматься гравировками сундука. На сегодняшний день у Олтин возникли финансовые проблемы, по которым ей не хватает денег для купли материалов. Она надеется, что с кредитом она сможет далее продолжить свою работу.
texts.en: Oltin is a resident of the Shahrituz District. She is 48 years old and married. She has a 19-year-old son. Over the course of many years, Oltin has practiced an ancient trade. She engraves trunk-chest walls, filling them with different colors and drawings. Oltin received this trade from as a legacy from her parents. This skill is passed down from generation to generation. Oltin accepted this calling and to this day continues to practice trunk engraving. Now, some financial difficulties have arisen for Oltin so that she does not have enough money to buy materials. She hopes that with this loan, she will be able to continue her work longer.

loans.use: to buy materials for engraving trunk box walls.

loans.name: Makhsatoy

texts.ru: Махсатой замужняя женщина в возрасте 66 лет. Она 10 лет своей жизни провела работая на земле. Махсатой занимается земледелием. Она на своем земельном участке выращивает овощи. На данный момент начался новый сезон для посева урожая и Махсатой готовиться к посеву активно. Она просит кредит, потому что ей не хватает средств, чтобы купить семена овощей для ежегодного посева. Она надеется на Вашу отзывчивость и поддержку. Поддержите Махсатой.
texts.en: Makhsatoy is a married 66-year-old woman. She has spent 10 years of her life working the land. Makhsatoy practices crop farming. She grows vegetables on her plot of land. Now, the new sowing season has begun and Makhsatoy is actively preparing for sowing. She is requesting a loan because she does not have enough money to buy vegetable seeds for the annual sowing season. She relies on your kind-heartedness and assistance. Please support Makhsatoy.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds for the annual sowing season.

loans.name: Dự

texts.en:
Mrs. Dự works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is 52 years old and married with two children.  Dự lives with one dependent in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Dự has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. In 2014, Dự joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Dự has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Dự faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to repair her latrine/toilet.

With her business profit, Dự hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to repair her latrine/toilet .

loans.name: Gulchera

texts.ru: Гулчера 59-летняя жительница города Турсунзаде. Она живет с мужем, двумя сыновьями, двумя невестками и внуками. Гулчера занимается собственным маленьким бизнесом. На протяжении 20 лет она занимается купле-продажей тканей и материалов. У нее большой опыт в этой сфере. Она продает свои ткани в селах и отдаленных кишлаках, чтобы их жительницы могли не выходя из дома приобрести необходимые им ткани. Сейчас в канун большого праздника "Навруз" Гулчера хочет увеличить ассортимент тканей, так как женщины будут покупать ткани для шитья новых платьев. Гулчера хочет воспользоваться удобным случаем и увеличить количество продаж.
texts.en: Gulchera is a 59-year-old resident of Tursun-zoda city. She lives with her husband, two sons, two daughters-in-law and grandchildren. Gulchera has her own small business. For the past 20 years, she has been in the business of buying and reselling fabric and materials. She has a lot of experience in this field. She sells her fabrics in towns and remote villages so that the female residents there are able buy the necessary fabrics without leaving their homes. Now, on the eve of the large holiday "Navruz" (Persian New Year), Gulchera wants to increase her variety of fabrics, as women will buy fabric for sewing new dresses. Gulchera wants to seize this opportunity and increase her number of sales.

loans.use: to buy fabric and materials for developing her retail business.

loans.name: Andres Mauricio

texts.es:
Andrés tiene 21 años y nació en Bogotá, distrito capital de Colombia. Es hijo único y solo vive con su madre quien actualmente trabaja en el Banco Caja Social. A pesar de algunas dificultades que surgieron en el tiempo en que estaba realizando sus estudios, Andrés obtendrá el título de Economista en la Universidad Nacional de Colombia en septiembre de 2014, cumpliendo así su sueño de ser profesional.
Andrés tiene el sueño de realizar una maestría en el área de Finanzas y para lograrlo necesita solicitar el apoyo de Kiva, puesto que es la única opción que tiene en este momento poder cubrir los gastos de exámenes de idioma y aplicación a las universidades. Una vez realice su maestría y regrese a Colombia, Andrés anhela trabajar en proyectos en el área de Finanzas, donde pueda contribuir al crecimiento económico del país y así poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la población colombiana, gracias al buen manejo y gestión de los recursos, dado que estará en capacidad de contribuir como asesor en los sectores público y privado, para el desarrollo de iniciativas que son trasversales para el país como proyectos de infraestructura que mejoren las condiciones de la sociedad y contribuya a que se acceda de forma completa a los recursos, sobre todo aquellas poblaciones que no tienen esta posibilidad actualmente. Además de la consecución de recursos para proyectos empresariales de pequeña o mediana empresa para apoyar los emprendedores que deseen innovar, pero que no tienen los recursos necesarios para hacerlo.
Aquí está su historia: 
A pesar de que cuento con el apoyo de mi familia para cumplir este sueño, mi madre no puede llegar a cubrir gastos tan elevados como estos debido a su limitada situación económica. Actualmente, estoy haciendo mi práctica profesional en el Banco de la República y en el pasado he llevado a cabo proyectos con enfoque social, como “Cuéntanos tu Sueño”, un proyecto que tenía como iniciativa la posibilidad de que cada estudiante de las universidades Nacional y de los Andes pudiera escribir su sueño en un sitio determinado, dando una colaboración monetaria. Con esto, fue posible recaudar fondos para cumplir los sueños de tres niñas de bajos recursos que de otra forma no habrían sido posibles. De igual manera, mi educación siempre ha sido un eslabón importante en mi vida y ha sido el motor que me inspira a ser cada día mejor.
Kiva sería el apoyo que necesito para superar los primeros pasos de este largo camino y el impulso para poder realizar esta maestría en el exterior, dado que gracias a Kiva podría realizar los estudios que necesito para preparar y presentar no solo mi examen para certificar un segundo idioma, sino también el examen de conocimiento que exige la universidad y que me permitiría cumplir mi proyecto de vida. 
Estoy seguro que gracias a mi excelencia académica y un gran esfuerzo puedo lograr cumplir las metas que me he trazado para ser mejor persona y poder contribuir al progreso de Colombia. Soy consciente de que la educación en Colombia es fiel reflejo de las vicisitudes de nuestro país y que existen amplias brechas en el sistema de educación en términos de calidad, profundidad y pertinencia que impiden que ésta cumpla su rol como herramienta transformadora de la sociedad en la que vivimos. Es por eso que he buscado diferentes instituciones, donde ofrecen programas que abordan las finanzas desde diferentes perspectivas, como la importancia de las matemáticas como herramienta de análisis (caso MIT), el estudio de caso para entender el fenómeno desde otros puntos de vista (caso Harvard), la importancia de las finanzas corporativas (caso LSE) o el escenario que reúne elementos prácticos y teóricos (caso Princeton).
texts.en:
Andrés is 21 years old and was born in Bogotá, the capital of Colombia. He is an only child and lives with his mother who currently works at the Banco Caja Social. In spite of certain difficulties that have arisen since he began his studies, Andrés will receive a degree in Economics from the National University of Colombia in September 2014, thus realizing his dream of becoming a professional. 

Andrés has a dream of completing a masters in finance, and in order to do so he needs to take this loan through Kiva, as it's his only option at the moment for covering the costs of language exams and university applications. Once he gets his masters and comes back to Colombia, he looks forward to working on projects in the area of finance, where he can contribute to the economic growth of the country and thus improve the quality of life for Colombians through good management and stewardship of resources. He would be in a position to contribute as a consultant, in both the public and private sectors, to the development of initiatives with transformative power for the country, like infrastructure projects that improve social conditions and make resources more accessible, especially for those populations that don't currently have access. Furthermore, he would help to secure financial resources for small and medium sized businesses and entrepreneurs seeking to innovate, but who don't have the necessary resources to do so. 

Here is his story: 

Even though I have the support of my family, my mother can't manage to cover such high costs as those I'm facing, given her limited means. Currently, I'm completing an internship at the Banco de la República and, prior to that, I lead social projects like "Tell Us Your Dream," a project that aims to get every student from the National University and University of the Andes to write down their dream and get financial assistance. This project made it possible to raise funds to achieve the dreams of three girls with limited resources, who wouldn't have been able to do so otherwise. In the same way, my education has always been a critical part of my life and has been the engine that inspires me to be better every day.  

Kiva would be the support I need to make the first steps of this long journey and the motivation to get a masters internationally. Thanks to Kiva, I would be able to take the classes I need to to prepare for not only my language exam, but also the basic knowledge exam required by the university and that would allow me to advance my life project. 

I am confident that thanks to my excellent academic record and with a lot of hard work, I will be able to succeed in meeting the goals that have pushed me to become a better person and be able to contribute to the progress of Colombia. I am aware that the educational system in Colombia is a faithful reflection of the fluctuations of our country and that there are ample gaps in the system, in terms of quality, depth, and applicability, that impede the system's ability to fulfill its role as a transformative tool for the society in which we live. This is why I have looked into different institutions that offer programs that approach finance from various perspectives, such as the importance of mathematics as an analytical tool (like MIT), of case studies to understand a phenomenon from other points of view (like Harvard), the importance of corporate finance (like the London School of Economics), or the integration of practical and theoretical elements (like Princeton).

loans.use: to cover the costs of applying to masters programs in finance.

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es:
La joven Juana Paula es una madre soltera que habita en una ciudad llamada Condega a unos 35 km al norte de la cabecera departamental de Estelí, ella reside en su casa de habitación junto a sus padres y su hija, muy conocida por lo vecino como una persona trabajadora y de buenas relaciones.
En la actualidad esta joven se dedica a comprar café molido por mayor y después lo revende en este municipio a empresas y pulperias  teniendo ella ya su clientela establecida por que vende café orgánico de buena calidad y buen sabor, siendo esta su principal fuente de ingreso para su su sento como para el de su hija que esta cursando la primaria actualmente.
ella se presento a las oficinas de CEPRODEL con el objetivo de hacer una nueva solicitud de crédito para poder comprar mas café y por ende aumentar sus ventas ya que la demanda lo amerita. ella se muestra objetiva que  se le aprobara el crédito y podrá mejorar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos
texts.en:
Juana Paula is a single mother who lives in a city called Condega, 35 kilometers to the north of the provincial capital of Esteli.  She lives in her house along with her parents and her daughter.  She is well-known by her neighbors as being a hardworking person who relates well to others. 

At this time, this young woman has a business buying ground coffee at wholesale and re-selling it in her municipality to the companies and stores.  She already has an established customer base, because she sells good quality organic coffee that tastes great.  As this is her main source of income to support herself and her daughter, who attends elementary school, Juana Paula came to the offices of CEPRODEL with the goal making a new loan application so that she can buy more coffee.  This way she can increase her sales, because she has sufficient demand. Juana Paula hopes that her loan application will be approved so that she will be able to increase her sales and thereby increase her income.

loans.use: to buy ground coffee to sell

loans.name: Jairo Isaac

texts.es:
Jairo es una persona de 26 años de edad, es muy responsable, respetuoso y trabajador, él se ha crecido con su madre que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. 
El joven ha realizado sus estudios hasta bachillerato y se ha dedicado a la venta de frutas y verduras desde que tenía 15 años,  en la actualidad se ha convertido en principal fuente de ingresos. Él se levanta a las 5 de la mañana y se dispone a salir con el carro de su madre hacia una ciudad, lugar donde compra las frutas y verduras que posteriormente serán distribuidas en el  mercado y los cantones de su municipio.  

De esta forma viaja 3 veces a la semana para comprar nuevas frutas y verduras y de esta manera se gana la vida honradamente, a esta actividad se suma su hermana los fines de semana, ya que los demás días los dedica al estudio. 


El dinero será utilizado reparación y mejoramiento del vehículo, ya que necesita un urgente cambio de embrague y frenos, y otra parte del dinero será utilizada en compra de frutas y verduras. De esta forma ampliara y surtirá su negocio y obtendrá mejores ingresos económicos y dará un mejor servicio a sus clientes.   


Las proyecciones que el joven tiene a futuro son las de pagar el crédito y adquirir otro para comprar un vehículo más reciente que le sirva para movilizarse a comprar y a distribuir frutas y verduras  en los cantones y caseríos de su municipio. Quiere ser independiente tener su casa su esposa sus hijos y siempre dedicarse a la venta de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Jairo is 26 years old. He is very responsible, respectful, and hardworking. He was raised by his mother, who sells fruits and vegetables.

He finished his studies through high school and has worked selling fruits and vegetables since he was 15 years old, and this is now his main source of income. He gets up at 5:00 in the morning and goes with his mother’s car to a city where he buys the fruits and vegetables that will later be distributed in the market and small towns of his municipality. 

He goes 3 times per week to buy new fruits and vegetables and in this way he earns an honorable living. His sister helps him with his business on the weekends because she studies during the other days of the week.

The money will be used to repair and improve the vehicle, because it urgently needs to have the clutch and brakes changed. Another part of the money will be used to buy fruits and vegetables. In this way he will expand and stock his business and earn a better income and provide better service to his customers.

His plans for the future are pay the loan and to then get another in order to buy a newer vehicle that will serve him as transportation to buy and distribute fruits and vegetables in the small towns of his municipality. He wants to be independent and have his own house, a wife, and children, and to always sell fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to repair and improve his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Lelis

texts.es:
Lelis de 67 años de edad, es padre de tres hijos, es una persona  muy reconocida  en su comunidad y con una excelente personalidad, tiene una buena disposición de servicio a los demás, ya que forma parte de la junta directiva de desarrollo de su comunidad ,  él se creció con su madre y sus abuelos, quienes se dedicaban a la agricultura  especialmente a la siembra de granos básicos, recuerda que desde temprana edad acompañaba a su abuelo a los campos donde cultivan la tierra y en el acompañamiento que él hacia adquiría conocimiento y practica sobre los principales cultivos  maíz, frijoles y maicillo de esta manera se fue creciendo trabajando en  la agricultura por la mañana y estudiando por las tardes en la escuela de su comunidad.

Fue así como culmino sus estudios hasta noveno grado y ya no pudo continuar estudiando por la falta de recursos económicos y decidió comenzar a trabajar en la agricultura, con el paso del tiempo recibió una propuesta de prestar su servicio como voluntario de salud en su comunidad;  fue así como comenzó a desempeñarse en el ramo de promotor de salud en su comunidad. Fueron 3 meses los que estuvo como  voluntario; luego comenzó a devengar un salario que fue de gran ayuda para su familia que está formada por su esposa y sus 3 hijos de los cuales ya son independientes y tienen sus propios hogares.
 
Actualmente se dedica a la agricultura pues cumplió su tiempo laboral, según el código de trabajo y ahora tiene una pensión de parte del gobierno, pero aun él se dedica a la agricultura actividad que aprendió de su abuelo que dedico toda su vida  y realizando esta actividad tiene una experiencia de 40 años,  su hijo menor se suma a esta labor agrícola.

El dinero será utilizado en mejoramiento de  su vivienda, y será invertido en compra de un portón ya que su casa cuenta con una bodega donde guarda leña y almacena sus cosechas y a manera de tener seguridad en su casa mandara a poner un portón de estructura metálica para mayor seguridad. 


Las proyecciones que Lelis tiene a futuro son las de cancelar el crédito y tramitar una nueva solicitud por un monto mayor para tener parcelas de cultivos diversificadas, ya que siempre a anhelado ser un productor de hortalizas y distribuirlas en los mercados de los municipios más cercanos. Apoyar en la formación y educación  de sus nietos para hacerlos personas de bien para su familia y su comunidad.
texts.en:
Lelis is 67 years old and the father of three children. He is a well-recognized person in his community with an excellent personality. He has a good service-oriented disposition, and he is part of the community development council. He grew up with his mother and grandparents, who worked in agriculture, especially growing basic grains. He remembers that since an early age he accompanied his grandfather to the fields where they cultivated the land, and during those times he acquired knowledge and practice of the principle crops of corn, beans, and sorghum. In this way, he grew up working in agriculture in the morning and studying in the afternoons in the community school. 

He finished his studies through the ninth grade and no longer could continue studying due to the lack of economic resources, and he decided to start to work in agriculture. With the passing of time, he received a proposal to lend his services as a health volunteer in his community. It was in this way that he started to perform side duties of promoting health in his community. He was a volunteer for three months. Later he started to earn a salary that was of great help for his family which is formed by his wife and their three children, who are already independent and have their own homes. 

Currently he works in agriculture. Since he finished his working years, according to the code of work and he now has a pension from the government, but he still works in agriculture, an activity that he learned from his grandfather, and to which he dedicated his whole life. He has 40 years of experience doing this activity, and his youngest son joins in this agricultural work. 

The money will be used for improvements to his home. It will be invested in the purchase of a gate, since his house has a storehouse where he keeps firewood and his harvest. In order to have security in his house, he will order a metal gate for maximum security. 

The projections that Lelis has for the future are the paying-off of the loan, and making a new request for a greater amount to have plots of diverse crops, since he has always yearned to be a producer of vegetables and to distribute them in the markets of the closest municipalities. He also wishes to support in the raising and education of his grandchildren in order to hake them good people for their family and community.

loans.use: to buy a gate since his house has a storehouse where he keeps firewood and his harvest.

loans.name: Leishiton

texts.en:
Notwithstanding the setup and the background of her upbringing, Leishiton is an intelligent, friendly and outgoing person. She is pictured with her mother, standing on the left side. She is from Ukhrul, which is a district of Manipur in the northeast part of India. She grew up in a humble home where she was taught to be kind and loving. Leishiton’s father is a cultivator and her mother is a homemaker. Their main source of income is from their paddy [rice] field. Seasonally, they harvest paddy and sells it in bulk. She has two brothers and a sister.

Despite all odds and challenges, very fascinatingly, Leishiton has been aspiring to become an air hostess ever since her childhood. Since her college days, she has struggled a lot to get a decent job and get enrolled in prestigious colleges. However, financial issues have always been a great hurdle for her in pursuing any decent career. “In fact, I am so fortunate to be one of the successful candidates, because I did not have proper training nor any experience in aviation," says Leishiton with a wide smile.

Though she got selected through an interview, Leishiton was a little worried, because she has to pay a huge sum as a security deposit. This is mandatory for all successful candidates to undergo training. As this would be an extra burden to her parents, she didn't want to trouble them. Therefore, she sought help from a few of her friends, and they recommended Kiva which provides loans to those who need financial help. Leishiton was so overjoyed and excited when she learned about Kiva! She thanks the people who are so generous and such a great help to helpless persons like her.

With this Kiva loan, she will pay the refundable deposit, earn her living and support her family. She wishes to extend her help to her parents by providing her siblings with a good education and a decent career, ensuring that they don’t suffer to get a job like her.

loans.use: To pay for a security deposit for cabin crew training so that she can earn her living and be independent.

loans.name: María Dora

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 47 años de edad,  madre de 1 hija y dos hijos. Se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos de su hogar, se preocupa por mantener su hogar lo más higiénico posible ya que vela por la salud y la alimentación de su hijos y sus nietos.

La señora María se creció con su abuela quien se dedicaba a realizar los oficios domésticos de su hogar,  mientras que su abuelo se dedicaba a la agricultura,  actividad que realizo toda su vida y le sirvió para llevar el sustento diario a su familia, con el paso del tiempo la señora se casó, con quien son padres de 3 hijos de los cuales una hija y un hijo se encuentran es los estados unidos y el menor se encuentra estudiando octavo grado en el centro escolar de su comunidad. 


María tiene una experiencia de 35 años en realizar la actividad de oficios domésticos para su familia,  es una actividad que aprendió de su abuela que fue una señora que dedico toda su vida en realizar esta actividad y fue quien le inculco buenos principios y valores morales los que hoy en día la han llevado a ser una buena persona de éxito para su familia y su comunidad, una de sus fuente de ingreso depende de la venta de productos lácteos que ella misma elabora ya que su esposo es dueño de dos vacas lecheras, a esta actividad se suma su hijo menor quien es el encargado de dar el cuidado necesario a las vacas y su fuente principal de ingresos depende de las remesas que son envías da departe de sus hijos y de su esposo.

El dinero será utiliza en la compra de muebles para el hogar y consolidar deuda que adquirieron cuando compraron las vacas.

Los planes que la señora tiene para un futuro son los de apoyar en la educación de su hijo y sus nietos hasta que sean unos profesionales, ya que manifiesta que su hijo el menor quiere estudiar para agrónomo en la universidad nacional.
texts.en:
María is 47 years old. She is the mother of 1 daughter and two sons. She is a homemaker. She works to keep her home as clean as possible because she looks after the health and nutrition of her children and grandchildren.

María grew up with her grandmother, who was a homemaker. Her grandfather worked in agriculture, which he did for his whole life and it served him to provide for his family. With the passage of time, María got married and she and her husband had 3 children. One daughter and one son live with their partners and the youngest is studying in eighth grade in the local school.

María has 35 years of experience in taking care of the household for her family. This is an activity she learned from her grandmother, who was a woman who dedicated her life to this activity and who taught her good principles and values, which have now led to her being a good and successful person for her family and her community. One of her sources of income is the sale of dairy products that she herself makes since her husband owns two milk cows. Her youngest son helps her with this business. He is responsible for caring for the cows. Her main source of income is the remittances that are sent by her children and her husband. 

The money will be used to buy furniture for the house and to consolidate debt they acquired when they bought the cows.

María’s plan for the future is to support the education of her son and her grandchildren until they become professionals. She explains that her youngest son wants to study to be an agricultural specialist in the national university.

loans.use: to buy furniture for the house and to consolidate a debt they acquired when they bought their cows.

loans.name: Doeurn

texts.en:
Doeurn is a 38-year-old married woman blessed with four children.  She describes herself as illiterate, but hardworking and honest in her daily farming work.  She operates a farm where she grows rice for sustenance and for sale.  She has been involved in this business for over 20 years.  Her business is located in the viable location of Bakan district, Pursat province, Cambodia.  She describes her greatest business challenge to be small returns.

Doeurn would like to acquire a loan that she will use to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members to improve her household sanitation practices.  Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Doeurn is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family, and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Sr De Coyllority Picchu Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR DE COYLLORITY PICCHU” viven en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco. 

Yahaira tiene 21 años y se dedica a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la venta de comida. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, verduras, carne y otras cosas.   
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de servicio de taxi, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de transporte.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Sr de Coyllority Picchu communal bank. They live in the beautiful city of Cusco.

Yahaira, 21, works by traveling and selling food. She has been in this business for several years. She is a hard-working woman who moves her family forward. Currently, she needs a loan to buy supplies such as rice, vegetables, meat, and other items.

The other members work in food sales, taxi services, managing a grocery store, and transportation.

Yahaira is grateful to those who take part in her dream in this way and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sacks of rice, meat, and other items.

loans.name: Esther Wanja

texts.en:
Esther is 55 years old, is from Nyandarua South, and is married. She has three children, ages 15 to 20 years old. 

Esther has a farming business that she has been running for many years. She has applied for her second loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her to buy farm inputs like seedlings and fertilizers. Esther is optimistic that she will do better after the loan. 

She hopes to borrow larger loans in the future so as to boost and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is 42 years old from Nakuru. He is married to Joyce and they are blessed with two children, ages 3 and 10 years old.

He has been running his business, grinding cereals like maize, wheat, and millet for his customers, for the last eight years. To enable him to buy more stock of the products he uses, so as to produce more flour to sell to his customers, he has applied for his first loan of 100,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya.

His monthly income right now is 50,000 KES and he plans to use the profits realized from his expanded business to buy another posho mill and to pay his loan back from VisionFund Kenya. In the future, he hopes to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy maize, wheat, sorghum, and millet to grind and sell to his customers

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a married woman from the town of Albur, Bohol. She is a mother of two young children. Her husband works as a driver to support their family. Patricia engages in raising hogs to help augment the income of their household. 
 
Patricia earns a living through her hog raising business. She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. Through this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her business, which will allow her to augment her income. Patricia wants to expand her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.en:
Sanoat was born in 1967. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a builder and she works in a local school. She is an accountant. She has worked in a school for more than 12 years. Sanoat is one of the best workers. She always works for the well-being of her children. 

Her daughter Mehrangez is a student. She studies well. Sanoat must to pay the tuition of her daughter’s education but she does not have enough money. Sanoat is asking for a loan of 800 USD to pay for the education of her daughter. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for the education of her daughter

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude is 27 years old. He is single. He sells various merchandises and has been in the business for the past three years. Jean Claude would like to get a loan for buying more soaps and sugar for sale. He plans to use the profits from the business to save more for the better future of his business.

loans.use: to buy more soaps and sugar for resale

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives in Aygehovit village in the Tavush region of Armenia.  She lives there with her big family of 7: including her husband, parents-in-law, grandmother-in-law and two little kids (ages 3 and 1 year old).  This hardworking family is engaged in agriculture.  They keep livestock (pigs, piglets and chickens), cultivate corn, potatoes, and grow fruit trees (peach, plum, fig, nut, apple and pear trees).  Susanna's husband also trades with coal in nearby communities.  Her father-in-law rents a small space where he trades with different types of household goods. 

Susanna has applied for a loan of 3,000 USD to provide financial support for her farm.  As the gathered harvest is big, it is very difficult for the family to organize all of the cultivation and gathering processes without agro machinery.  The rental cost of agro machinery is too high for the family, therefore this loan will be a huge support for them and they will be able to purchase agro machinery for harvest gathering and forage for the livestock.

loans.use: to pay for agro machinary for harvest gathering and forage for the lievstock

loans.name: Ridha

texts.en:
Ridha runs a small stall selling airtime credits for mobile phones. Ridha lives in Lebak, a semi-urban area about 3 hours from Jakarta. Ridha is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Ridha began working with PT Rekan Usaha Mikro Anda (Ruma) 3 months ago because he became interested in selling airtime credits. He feels really excited to expand his business. For the last 3 months, he has made around $36–37 per day in sales on average (just airtime credit sales). As the business expands, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on the weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Desti

texts.en:
Desti runs a small stall selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Desti lives in Lebak, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. Desti is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Desti began working with Ruma one month ago because she was interested in selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business by selling mobile phone airtime credits. For the last month, she has around $27 – 28 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna, a 47-year-old business lady in Mwingi, has a business as a poultry farmer. She is married to Robert, who is also a farmer. Her children are aged 26, 24, 20, 16 and 14 years old respectively. She also offers money transfer services and a retail shop, businesses which both supplement her income. 

She earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which she uses to support her family. This marks her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya after she repaid her previous loan successfully. With the loan she has applied for from VisionFund Kenya, she will be able to purchase poultry feed and one-day-\old chicks for rearing. 

Additional income created will allow her to improve the standard of living for her family and repay her loan. In the future, Anna would like to expand her businesses further. She hopes to have an established business, educate her children and have a settled family.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed and one-day-old chicks

loans.name: Komalasari

texts.en:
Komalasari runs a small stall selling snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. Komalasari lives in Lebak, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Komalasari is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Komalasari began working with Ruma six months ago because she was interested in selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business by selling mobile phone airtime credits. For the last three months, she has around $16 – 17 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Judin

texts.en:
Judin runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits. Judin lives in Lebak, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. Judin is single.

Judin began working with Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits. For the last month, he has around $9 – 10 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 41 years old, married, and has two children.

Marilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marilyn has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 23 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Marilyn aspires to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Lincoln

texts.en:
Lincoln, a 59-year-old married father of three from Embu has a business as a dairy farmer. He earns a monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family. This marks his second loan term with VisionFund Kenya after he repaid his previous loan successfully. 

With the loan he has applied for from VisionFund Kenya, Lincoln will be able to purchase another dairy cow and containers for storing milk. The additional income created will allow him to improve the standard of living for his family and to reinvest the remaining amount in his business. 

In the future, Lincoln would like to buy more dairy cows to increase the production of milk to supply to his clients. He hopes to become the leading milk supplier in his region.

loans.use: to purchase another dairy cow and containers for storing milk.

loans.name: Shahrigul

texts.en: Shahrigul was born in 1967. She is widowed and has a son. Her brother and his wife live in her house. Shahrigul is a very hardworking and smart woman. She has a pedagogical education. She has worked in a kindergarten as a pedagogy (teacher) for more than 17 years. She has great experience and knows her deal well. Shahrigul must organize a circumcision ceremony for her grandchild but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to make a circumcision ceremony for her grandchild. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To make a circumcision ceremony for her grandchild

loans.name: Thùy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thùy has a retail business selling dry food. Thùy is 40 years old and she is married with three children. Thùy lives with one dependent in Hoang Hoa, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her two other children are grown up.

In 2014, Thùy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thùy has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thùy has been involved in this business for five years. 

The main hardship that Thùy faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet, bathroom and water filter system.

With her business profit, Thùy hopes for her business to do well. She also hopes to build a new house and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet, bathroom and water filter system.

loans.name: Tanas

texts.en:
Tanas is a 57-year-old hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda with four children, one of whom is attending school. His main business is farming, in addition to selling secondhand clothes. 

Tanas is facing the challenge of inadequate capital, however, he has a vision of one day building a permanent home. Tanas has asked for a loan to plant maize for commercial purposes this season.

loans.use: to plant maize for commercial purposes.

loans.name: Thắng

texts.en:
Mr. Thắng works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Thắng has been involved in this business for 6 years.

Thắng is 30 years old, and he is married with two children. Thắng lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Thắng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve his business. Thắng has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Thắng faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet, bathroom and water-filter system.

With his business profit, Thắng hopes to make enough money to provide for his kids, to build a new house, and for his children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build s toilet, bathroom and water-filter system.

loans.name: Gilford

texts.en:
Gilford is 66 years old from Olkalou. He is married to Sabella and they are blessed with two children who are 16 and 14 years old.

Gilford has been running his mixed farming business for the last thirteen years. He has applied for his fourth loan of KES 54,000 from VisionFund Kenya to be able to buy maize and bean planting seeds and fertilizer.

His monthly income right now is KES 30,000 and he has plans of using profits realized from his expanded business to educate his children, buy a dairy cow and to pay his loan back to VisionFund Kenya. In the future, he hopes to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: To buy maize and bean planting seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Tuyết

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyết works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Tuyết has been involved in this business for 3 years.

Tuyết is 30 years old, and she is married with two children. Tuyết lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Tuyết joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tuyết has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Tuyết faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet, bathroom and water-filter system.

With her business profit, Tuyết hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to build a new house, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet, bathroom and water-filter system.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She operates a retail shop selling agriculture products. She sells her products on a retail basis. She works for seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last seven years. 

She has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy pesticides, fertilizers and seeds. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her shop on a wholesale basis. 

She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more pesticides, fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha, a 52 year old business lady from Thika, has a business as a poultry farmer. She is married to Charles who is also a farmer. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family. This marks her first loan term with VISIONFUND KENYA after she was introduced by an existing client. With the loan she has applied from VISIONFUND KENYA, she will be able to purchase poultry feed and purchase one day old chicks for rearing. Additional income created will allow her improve the standard of living for her family. In the future, Martha would like to expand her farming land. She hopes have an established business and a settled family.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed and purchase one day old chicks

loans.name: Joenalyn

texts.en: Joenalyn is a resident of Bohol, Philippines. She is 31 years old and a mother of three young children. She has been engaged in a fish selling or vending business for more than ten years now. This provides her the income that she needs for her family. Joenalyn is asking for a loan worth 19,000 PHP to buy more fish to sell and to buy feed for her hogs. With this loan she will be able to augment her income. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more. Joenalyn wants to send her children to school for their bright future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell and buy feed for her hogs

loans.name: Ziyodakhon

texts.en:
Ziyodakhon is 54 years old. She is a smart and hardworking woman. Ziyodakhon has five adult children. She has been busy with selling children's clothes for more than 15 years. She sells clothes in a shop. Ziyodakhon has great experience in this field. 

She is going to buy goods for the new spring season. Ziyodakhon is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni to buy children’s clothes. This loan will help her to widen the assortment of her goods, and in this way, develop her business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy children’s clothes

loans.name: Siliva

texts.en: Siliva lives in Hoima Uganda . He is a male, married, and aged 34 years. He has 8 children and four of them attend school. He deals in waragi, a local brew, and earns additional income from produce. He got his starting capital from motorcycle transport. His main customers are Hoima waragi transporters. He has hopes of buying a personal car since he finds the bad roads a challenge during transportation. A second challenge is inadequate capital. He is hardworking-man and would like to use the loan to buy more local brew(waragi) to sell.

loans.use: to buy more local brew (waragi) to sell.

loans.name: Shohpari-Khonim

texts.en: Shohpari-Khonim is a smart girl. She was born in 1994 in the capital of Tajikistan. Her parents are poor people. Her father is a migrant. Her mother works in an organization. There are six children in her house. Shohpari-Khonim always wanted to get a higher education and to build a good career in the future. She graduated school with excellent marks. She entered the branch of Moscow State University in Tajikistan. She chose the profession of linguist. She is a very perfect girl and studies at the second course. She must pay for her education at the university but her parents have no money. She is asking for a loan to pay for tuition at the university. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay university tuition

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Saret is 48, married and has four children. She currently lives with her family in a favorable area of Bakan, Pursat where she operates a farming business for a livelihood. She is very hardworking and honest with her daily farming activities because she wants to ensure food security and provide basic necessities for her household. She has been a farmer for nearly 30 years now.

Saret would like to obtain a loan which she will use to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members and so as to improve her household sanitation practices. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Saret is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 42 years old and is from Nyahururu. She is married to Edward and they are blessed with two children aged 22 and 20 years old.

She owns a private school, a business she has been running for the last five years, and to enable her to buy teaching materials like chalk, dusters and textbooks, she has applied for her first loan of KES 30,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Her monthly income right now is KES 50,000 and she has plans to use the profits realized from her expanded business to build more classes and to pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya. In the future, she hopes to own the biggest learning institution in her region.

loans.use: to buy teaching materials like chalk, dusters and textbooks

loans.name: On

texts.en: On is a 47-year-old married woman with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province. She makes cake to sell for profit and her husband and two children work as factory laborers. All of them earn 11 USD per day. Now she would like to apply for a loan of 700 USD to buy snacks to sell for profit. This loan will help her open a small business purchasing and selling snacks. In the future, she hopes that she can breed pigs and chickens.

loans.use: To buy snacks to sell for profit

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.en: Muhabat was born in 1976. She sews women’s dresses. She began this business 18 years ago. Muhabat runs her business well because she has great experience. Muhabat feeds and keeps 5 children. Her husband is a builder. Now, Muhabat and her husband are going to repair their house. Muhabat is asking for a loan of 800 USD to buy building materials like cement, wood, paint, etc. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials like cement, wood, paint, etc. for house repairs

loans.name: Duaa

texts.en: Duaa is a 20-year-old lady living in a sector in Jordan called Baqaa with her family that consists of 11 members. She is a university student majoring in Children's Education. She is planning to work in her field of study after graduation to start supporting her family financially. However, she doesn't have enough money for her university fees. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Jimpson

texts.es:
Jimpson, es un joven de 25 años de edad, vive en la calidad ciudad  de Pucallpa, la cual se encuentra en la selva peruana y tiene una fauna y flora maravillosa.  Jimpson es un joven con un carisma contagiante y sobre todo con muchas ganas der salir adelante, por ello con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera técnica de instalación de conexiones eléctricas. Gracias a ello ha logrado conseguir empleo en un pequeño taller en la cual puede atender a sus clientes y con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar. 

Jimpson está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le dan su confianza y gracias a ello podrá comprar un auto de segunda así podrá alquilarlo y/o realizar taxi y de esta manera poder mejorar sus ingresos y poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Tener su propio taller y poder estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Jimpson is a 25-year-old man who lives in the city of Pucallpa, which is found in the Peruvian forest and has wonderful fauna and flora. Jimpson is a young man with a contagious charisma, and who above all has a keen desire to get ahead in life. To do so, through a lot of hard work, he succeeded in pursuing a technical career in installing electrical connections. It is thanks to this that he managed to find a job in a small workshop in which he tends to his customers and he can help his parents with the household costs through the fruit of his work. 

Jimpson is very grateful to the Kiva loan lenders as this is the second time that they have shown their confidence in him and thanks to this that he will be able to buy a second-hand car so that he can rent it out and/or provide taxi services to improve his income and make his greatest dream a reality, that of having his own workshop and being able to study a university degree.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Saifaldeen

texts.en: Saifaldeen is 18 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his 4 brothers and his mother. His father is deceased. Saifaldeen is a university student majoring in Statistics. He is in his first year of studies. He is planning to find a good job after graduation to help support his family financially given the financial challenges they have faced since his father's death.

loans.use: To pay fees for his upcoming semester

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Mustafa is 20 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Rsaifeh with his 3 siblings and his mother. His father is deceased. Mustafa is a university student majoring in Children's Education. He is in his second year. He is planning to find a good job after graduation to help his family financially given the financial challenges they have faced since his father's death.

loans.use: To pay fees for his upcoming semester

loans.name: Echo Des Anges De Ouanaminthe Group

texts.fr:
Denise est la coordinatrice de son groupe Echo des Anges. Elle est mariée elle a 2 enfants. Elle habite dans la région nord`est Haïti ou l’électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limite.

Denise dirige son commerce de vente de produits alimentaire pendants les 6 dernières années. Avant de ce commerce elle était la vendeuse de toute sorte. Elle espère que ce emprunt l’aidera a grandir son commerce

Des autres membres de groupe ont besoin d'un emprunt pour les commerces tel que ventes produits cosmétiques, boissons gazeuses etc. Elle dit que son défi principal est de devenir une plus grande commerçante dans la zone. Son but principal c’est d’avoir un plus grand commerce qui lui facilitera à construire une plus grande maison avec prêt de Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Denise is the coordinator of the "Echo des Anges" group. She is married and has two children. She lives in the northern region of Haiti where electricity is rare and drinkable water is very limited.

Denise has been working selling food products for the last six years. Before this, she sold other various products. She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business.

The other group members need a loan for their businesses which involve selling cosmetics, carbonated beverages, etc.

Denise said that her main challenge is becoming the largest merchant in the area. Her main goal is to have a large enough business so that she can build a larger house with a loan from Esperanza International.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en: Rania is a 21-year-old single lady who lives with her 6 other family members. She is a university student majoring in Planning and Management in her 4th year. Since she has a sense of responsibility for her family, she decided to get her bachelor's degree to find a job in her field that will allow her to help her family financially. Now she is applying for this loan to pay for her last semester fees as she gets closer to graduation.

loans.use: To pay fees for her upcoming semester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a car for distributing cooking gas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy frozen goods and other goods

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shrimp and corn

loans.name: Massavo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MASSAVO est composé de cinq personnes qui ont des liés familiaux. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Bernadette Edjacho(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo)âgée de 38 ans a très peu fréquenté l'école. Bernadette Edjacho est mariée à un conducteur du nom de Salomon. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Bernadette Edjacho vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges familiales sont supportées par Bernadette Edjacho et son mari. C’est pour cette raison, Bernadette Edjacho vend du maïs, du riz et des pâtes alimentaires par la technique de distribution depuis une vingtaine d'années. Bernadette Edjacho s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle Bernadette Edjacho ensemble avec les membres du groupe MASSAVO sollicitent un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Massavo group is made up of five people who share family ties. The representative of the group, Bernadette Edjacho (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 38 years old and has attended some school. She is married to a driver named Salomon. The couple has three children, who all go to school and who are still under their parents' care. Bernadette Edjacho lives with her husband and children. The couple together supports the family's expenses.

It is for this reason that Bernadette Edjacho has been selling corn, rice, and pasta using a particular method of distribution for the last 20 or so years. She procures her goods from a market in Benin.

In order to strengthen her business and better meet demand, Bernadette Edjacho, together with the other group members, is seeking a third loan through Alide. Their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, and pasta

loans.name: Ghadeer

texts.en: Ghadeer was born in 1990. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is serving with the military. Ghadeer has been selling clothes for one year. She started her business to help her husband improve the family's living conditions. She is planning to buy more clothes and increase her stock so she can continue her business. Ghadeer made an agreement with some customers about some clothes and is requesting a youth loan to be able to buy them.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of clothes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Manal

texts.en: Manal is a 48-year-old mother of five children. She asked her son to appear in the photo for her because she is conservative. Manal has a small business at home that she wants to expand by selling perfume and other cosmetic products. For that reason, she is applying for a loan to bring in new types of cosmetics and more make-up products.

loans.use: to bring in new types of cosmetics and perfumes to sell

loans.name: José Ángel

texts.es:
José de 61 años de edad, es una persona con excelentes principios morales y espirituales con una buena disposición de servicio en su comunidad,  es padre de 4 hijos, es una persona muy ejemplar para su familia.

 Se dedica a la agricultura, desde temprana edad, recuerda con claridad que desde  los 10 años acompañaba a su padre al trabajo, llevando consigo un machete una lima y sus caites como implementos de trabajo, de esta manera adquirió experiencia y conocimiento sobre la agricultura que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingreso, se siente orgulloso de realizar esta actividad ya que le ha servido para llevar el sustento diario a su familia que está formada por su esposa que se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su hogar y dos de sus hijos se encuentran estudiando en el instituto nacional y sus otros dos hijos son independientes y se encuentran en los estados unidos.


Aprendió de su padre las labores agrícolas, quien se sentía orgulloso de cultivar la tierra su día iniciaba a las 4 de la mañana a cultivar la tierra de forma rustica utilizando solo herramientas manuales. Los campos donde cultivan se encuentran a 2 kilómetros de su casa. A parte del ingreso que le da la venta de sus cosechas, también recibe eventualmente remesas de sus dos hijos que están en estados unidos.


El dinero del crédito será invertido en la ampliación y mejoramiento de la vivienda,  ya que estas a pocos meses de iniciar el invierno y necesita ampliar el techo de su casa en el cual hará la construcción de dos corredores, ya que en el invierno pasado cuando las lluvias eran demasiado fuerte, el agua se filtraba bajo la puerta.  Con el préstamo en la época de lluvia tendrá una mejor tranquilidad al descansar en su casa y tendrán una vivienda más completa y digna.


Los planes de José a futuro son los de pagar el crédito y hacer una nueva solicitud por un monto mayor para hacer mejoramiento y ampliación de su casa, y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos hasta que sean unos profesionales de éxito y en cuanto a la agricultura hará una diversificación de cultivos y así podrá vender más variedad.
texts.en:
José, 61, is a person with high moral and spiritual principles with a very helpful nature in his community. He is a father to 4 children, he is an exemplary person for his family.

He makes his living in agriculture, and has done so from a very young age. José remembers with quite some clarity that from 10 years old he accompanied his father to work, carrying his work materials with him: a machete knife, a rasp and his sturdy sandals. It was in this manner that he acquired experience and knowledge about farming which has become his main source of income. José is proud of working in this field as it has served him to provide his family with their daily sustenance. His family is made up of his wife who looks after the house and two of his children who are studying in the national high school while his other two children are grown up and live in the United States.

José learned from his father how to perform farming work, who felt very proud of cultivating the land. His day started at 4 am by cultivating the land in a rudimentary fashion with manual tools. The fields in which they grow the crops is at 2 km from their home. Apart from the income that he makes through the sale of his crops, he also sometimes receives money from his two children who are in the United States.

The money from this loan will be invested in the expansion and improvement of his home as they are only a few months away from winter and José needs to extend the roof of his home by building two gutters. This is because last winter the rain was too heavy and the water entered into the house underneath the door. With the loan, José will be more at ease in the rainy season to rest at home and they will have a more complete and dignified home.

José's plans for the future are to repay the loan and make a new request for a larger value to improve and extend his home and support his children in their education until they become successful professionals, as for the farming, he will diversify the crops and therein have a larger variety of goods.

loans.use: to extend the roof of his home in which he will build two gutter.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris, a 24-year-old married mother of two from Thika, earns a living for her family by operating a retail shop. Her husband, Harrison, is also a business man. Damaris has been in this business for the past two years. She has been unable to keep her shop fully stocked due to lack of investment capital. 

Her goal is to fully stock her store to attract more customers and increase her profits. Damaris is requesting a loan from VisionFund Kenya to stock her shop with bread, rice, sugar, maize meal, cooking oil and flour. She will reinvest additional income she earns in her business to generate more profit and improve her family's living standards. 

In the future, Damaris plans to continue to invest in her business and to eventually operate a larger wholesale store.

loans.use: to stock her shop with bread, rice, sugar, maize meal, cooking oil, and flour

loans.name: Jesoudogbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESOUDOGBE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Aténoumè(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 29 ans est mariée à un éleveur du nom de Barthélémy. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Aténoumè vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges familiales sont supportées par Aténoumè et son mari. C’est pour cette raison, Aténoumè vend du gari(la farine de manioc)et divers produits à son domicile depuis cinq ans environ. Aténoumè s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de développer son activité et mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle Aténoumè ensemble avec les membres du groupe JESOUDOGBE sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Jesoudogbe group is made up of three people who live in the same area. The representative of the group, Aténoumè (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 29 years old and is married to a student named Barthélémy. The couple has two children, who both go to school and who are both under their parents' care. Aténoumè lives with her husband and children. Together the couple takes care of the family expenses.

For this reason, Aténoumè has been selling gari [manioc flour] and other goods from her home for about five years. She procures her goods from a market in Benin.

With the goal of developing her business and better meeting demand, Aténoumè, together with the other group members, is seeking a loan through Alide.

loans.use: to buy gari [manioc flour] and other goods

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her grow coffee.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 36 year old married mother of two children, aged 18 and 15 years old, who lives in Embu town, Kenya. She has been operating a beauty salon business for the past thirteen years, now earning a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which she uses to provide for her family. She is applying for her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. 

Nancy is delighted to have been introduced to VisionFund and will use the loan to purchase hair oils, driers, chemicals and weaves. With the expected profit, she will reinvest in her business and pay the school fees of her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a comfortable life and build rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase hair oils, driers, chemicals and weaves.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen has successfully built her general store business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. 

She offers a variety of goods at reasonable prices and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Her husband also assists her by purchasing required products from the wholesale market and by dealing with customers.  

To meet with the increasing demands of her customers she applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 through Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to purchase packs of oil, grains and sugar. She is in her 5th loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase packs of oil, grains and sugar.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 30-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She has been involved in a business selling iron strips for the past two years with the support of her husband. She buys large sheets of iron and then cuts them into small sizes; these strips are then used for packaging. In this way she earns a sufficient amount of income to meet the family's expenses. 

In order to meet everyday expenditures and business needs, more income is required so Farzana contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. She intends to use this loan amount to purchase iron sheets in a large quantity along with cutters. Farzana is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business. She dreams of expanding her business and dreams of improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets in a large quantity along with cutters.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is 30 years old and not yet married.

He is in a business of selling timber in Ndunyu Njeru which he has been running for two years with an estimated income of KES 30,000 per month.

He has applied for his fifth loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable him buy a stock of timber for sale. With the anticipated profit, he plans to pay back the loan and expand his business. In the near future, he hopes to expand his timber business to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy timber.

loans.name: Tres De Mayo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TRES DE MAYO” y viven en la comunidad de Mollomarca en la provincia de Paucartambo al sur de la ciudad de Cusco. La socia Valentina tiene 29 años y se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, ella también se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, cebada, trigo y otras cosas más. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono.  La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.(La socia que esta en la parte inferior de la fotografía pudio permiso para no estar presente en la reunión).

Los otros socios se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería y les va muy bien.
texts.en:
The members of the Tres de Mayo Community Bank live in the the community of Mollomarca in Paucartambo province, south of the city of Cusco.

29-year old Valentina is a member of the group. She raises animals such as guinea pigs and chickens, as well as growing potatoes, cabbage, wheat etc. on her land. She is an enterprising, hardworking woman who wants to help her family progress.

Valentina now requires a loan to buy seeds and manure. She is grateful to those who are helping her fulfill her dream and promises to pay back the money according to the schedule.

(The woman in the separate photo asked for permission to miss the meeting.)

The members earn their living in a variety of ways including farming and animal-raising. All is going well.

loans.use: Buy seeds and manure

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 30-year-old gentleman, married and a father of three. He is a livestock trader in Narok county, Kenya, and has been running the business for the past eight years. The trade earns him an approximate monthly income of KES 20,000.

He has borrowed a third loan of KES 60,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which he intends to use to purchase more livestock for resale. 

The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost the business. His future dream is to improve his family's living standards

loans.use: to purchase cows for trade.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Elisabeth est une femme de 51 ans célibataire et mère de 3 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 17 et 27 ans. elle est commerçante et vend de l'huile de palme dans un marché de la place depuis 7 ans déjà. C'est grâce à son commerce qu'elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille. son activité fonctionne bien, elle conquise et fidélisée une clientèle qui s'accroit au fil du temps. C'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter son stock de marchandises. ceci augmentera non seulement ses ventes mais aussi son bénéfice. bénéfice qui sera en parti réinvesti dans son activité et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Elisabeth is 51 years old, single, and a mother of three children, who are between 17 and 27 years old. She has worked selling palm oil in a local market for seven years. Thanks to this commerce, she is able to support the needs of her family.

Her business is successful, and she has attracted a loyal group of customers whose number continues to grow. It is for this reason that she seeks a loan to increase her stock. An increase in stock will not only increase sales but also her earnings.

Earnings will be partly reinvested back into her business. The rest will allow her to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock of palm oil

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 50 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Annie has a food business in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Annie has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
Emilda is 46 years old and a widowed mother of three children, two of whom are in school. Emilda works very hard to provide for them.

Emilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Emilda has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soap, seasonings and other groceries. 

In the future Emilda would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gjergj

texts.en: Gjergj paid for a dairy cow with the previous loan. This time he wants to make some basic improvements to his family's house seen in the photograph.

loans.use: to make basic repairs to his home and prepare  land for planting

loans.name: Ejaz

texts.en:
Ejaz has successfully built her business of cattle-raising with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She purchases animals (such as baby goats, calves) and after raising them for a year or two, she sells them in the local market. She makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

Currently she has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more cattle. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Mohannad

texts.en:
Mohannad is an 18-year-old single young man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. Mohannad's father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Mohannad is a student in a local university, where he studies engineering. 
Mohannad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Mohannad will be able to do his homework and write reports easily. 
Mohannad appears in the photo above.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy still runs her dairy farming business. She has also ventured into horticultural farming. Her business is doing so much better after receiving financial support from VISIONFUND KENYA and KIVA lenders. Mercy's monthly income has increased, totalling KES 15,000 after the loan advancement. She uses the income she earns to support her family.

This marks Mercy's third loan term with VISIONFUND KENYA, after repaying her previous loans successfully. She intends to use the loan to purchase farm inputs. With the additional income, she will educate her child and improve her farm further by adding more dairy cows.

Mercy hopes to become successful in her businesses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Abdel Rahman

texts.en:
Abdel Rahman is a 20-year-old single young man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. Abdel's father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Abdel is a student in a local university where he studies Mechanical Engineering. 

Abdel took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Abdel will be able to do his home works and write the reports easily. 

Abdel appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Liliana María

texts.es:
Liliana es una mujer luchadora y pujante de 30 años de edad, 8 de ellos dedicados a atender su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que inició con el fin de generar ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
El establecimiento está ubicado en un barrio que está en crecimiento urbanístico, lo que le permite atraer cada vez más clientes y aumentar el nivel de ganancias que obtiene por las ventas.
